analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: addressed the Bhagavān with these words:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos du dang ldan na myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos du dang ldan na myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya /
translated: if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have how many qualities, will they quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood?”🔽When he had finished speaking thus, the Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Subāhu,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lag bzang la 'di skad ces bka' @279b stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lag bzang la 'di skad ces bka' @279b stsal to //
translated: “Subāhu,

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Subāhu, in order to quickly attain complete and perfect awakening,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag rtag par rgyun du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag rtag par rgyun du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva should always and continuously perfect these six perfections.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag rtag par rgyun du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag rtag par rgyun du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Subāhu, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should always and continuously perfect these six perfections.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
translated: Subāhu, how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas complete the perfection of generosity?

original: lag bzang / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos kyis longs spyod pa rnams yongs su tshol gyi /
analyzed: lag bzang / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos kyis longs spyod pa rnams yongs su tshol gyi /
translated: Subāhu, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas seek enjoyments through Dharma,

original: chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no //
translated: not through non-Dharma.

original: mnyam pa nyid yin gyi mi mnyam pas ni ma yin no //🔽de srog chags gzhan dag dang / sems can gzhan rnams la gnod pa mi byed /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid yin gyi mi mnyam pas ni ma yin no // de srog chags gzhan dag dang / sems can gzhan rnams la gnod pa mi byed /
translated: They are equal, not unequal.

original: nyam nga ba mi byed par sbyin pa byin te /
analyzed: nyam nga ba mi byed par sbyin pa byin te /
translated: They give gifts without harming or distressing other living beings, other sentient beings.

original: brjod pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: brjod pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: They give gifts not for the sake of words, sounds, or verses,

original: 'dzem pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'dzem pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of propriety,

original: 'jigs pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of fear,

original: lan du phan 'dogs su re ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs su re ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of hoping for a reward,

original: mtho ris kyi phyir ma yin /🔽tshul 'chos @280a *//🔽pa ma yin /🔽kha gsag byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi phyir ma yin / tshul 'chos @280a *// pa ma yin / kha gsag byed pa ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of the higher realms,🔽not for the sake of hypocrisy,

original: brnyas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brnyas pa ma yin no //
translated: not for the sake of flattery,🔽not for the sake of contempt.

original: sbyin gnas sam sbyin gnas ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin gnas sam sbyin gnas ma yin pa'am /
translated: whether they are worthy of offerings or not,

original: mngon par grags pa'am mngon par grags pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par grags pa'am mngon par grags pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: whether they are famous or not,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am tshul khrims 'chal ba'am /🔽'dris pa'am ma 'dris pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am tshul khrims 'chal ba'am / 'dris pa'am ma 'dris pa'am /
translated: whether they have moral discipline or not,🔽whether they are familiar or not,

original: mdza' ba'am mi mdza' ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: mdza' ba'am mi mdza' ba yang rung ste /
translated: whether they are friends or not,

original: bkur stir byed /
analyzed: bkur stir byed /
translated: they honor them,

original: bla mar byed; rim gro byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed; rim gro byed /
translated: respect them,

original: mchod par byed cing 'dun pa drag po dang / dga' ba drag po dang / dad pa drag pos de nyung du bdog na'ang rung nyung du sbyin /
analyzed: mchod par byed cing 'dun pa drag po dang / dga' ba drag po dang / dad pa drag pos de nyung du bdog na'ang rung nyung du sbyin /
translated: and make offerings to them. With intense aspiration, intense joy, and intense faith, they give a little if they have a little,

original: mang du bdog na yang mang du sbyin bzang du bdog na yang bzang du sbyin /
analyzed: mang du bdog na yang mang du sbyin bzang du bdog na yang bzang du sbyin /
translated: give a lot if they have a lot, give good things if they have good things,

original: ngan pa bdog na yang ngan pa sbyin /
analyzed: ngan pa bdog na yang ngan pa sbyin /
translated: give bad things if they have bad things,

original: gya nom pa bdog na yang gya nom ba sbyin no //
analyzed: gya nom pa bdog na yang gya nom ba sbyin no //
translated: and give exquisite things if they have exquisite things.

original: lag bzang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong sbyin pa dang / rlabs po che'i sems dang / rangs pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: lag bzang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong sbyin pa dang / rlabs po che'i sems dang / rangs pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa de bzhin du /
translated: “Subāhu, just as bodhisattvas give with a hundred thousand acts of generosity, with a vast mind, and with a joyful mind,

original: ka k'a ni tsam yang sbyin zhing rlabs po che'i sems dang rangs pa'i sems kyis sbyin no //
analyzed: ka k'a ni tsam yang sbyin zhing rlabs po che'i sems dang rangs pa'i sems kyis sbyin no //
translated: He gives even a little, and he gives with a magnanimous mind and a joyful mind.

original: de zas 'dod pa rnams la sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bla na med pa'i stobs kyis brtan pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zas sbyin no //
analyzed: de zas 'dod pa rnams la sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bla na med pa'i stobs kyis brtan pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zas sbyin no //
translated: To those who want food, he gives food, in order that all beings may attain the strength of the unshakable, unsurpassed knowledge of a Tathagata.

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa'i skom pa thams cad bsal ba'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir skom sbyin no //
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa'i skom pa thams cad bsal ba'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir skom sbyin no //
translated: To those who want drink, he gives drink, in order that all beings may attain the strength to remove all the thirst of the passions.

original: gos 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod @280b pa'i gos thob par bya ba'i phyir gos sbyin no //
analyzed: gos 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod @280b pa'i gos thob par bya ba'i phyir gos sbyin no //
translated: To those who want clothes, he gives clothes, in order that all beings may attain the clothes of conscience and consideration.

original: bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bla na med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bzhon pa sbyin no //
analyzed: bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bla na med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bzhon pa sbyin no //
translated: To those who want vehicles, he gives vehicles, in order that all beings may attain the unsurpassed vehicles of the Bodhisattvas and the Buddhas.

original: spos 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims kyi dri bsung thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir spos sbyin no //
analyzed: spos 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims kyi dri bsung thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir spos sbyin no //
translated: To those who want incense, I give incense so that all beings may obtain the fragrance of the Buddha’s morality.

original: me tog 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog bla na med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir me tog rnams sbyin no //🔽phye ma 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can nyes par spyod pa'i dri nga ba'i dri ma gzhom pa'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir phye ma sbyin no //
analyzed: me tog 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog bla na med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir me tog rnams sbyin no // phye ma 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can nyes par spyod pa'i dri nga ba'i dri ma gzhom pa'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir phye ma sbyin no //
translated: To those who want flowers, I give flowers so that all beings may obtain the unsurpassed flowers of the seven factors of enlightenment of the Tathāgata.🔽To those who want powder, I give powder so that all beings may obtain the power to destroy the foul smell of bad actions.

original: byug pa 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad nyes pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / spyod pa'i byug pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byug pa sbyin no //
analyzed: byug pa 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad nyes pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / spyod pa'i byug pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byug pa sbyin no //
translated: To those who want ointments, I give ointments so that all beings may obtain the ointment of faultless morality and conduct.

original: gdugs 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir gdugs sbyin no //
analyzed: gdugs 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir gdugs sbyin no //
translated: To those who want parasols, he gives parasols in order to obtain the power to completely pacify all the torments of the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: lham 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i bde ba mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lham sbyin no //
analyzed: lham 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i bde ba mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lham sbyin no //
translated: To those who want shoes, he gives shoes in order to obtain the power to attain the superknowledges of the unsurpassed bliss of all sentient beings.

original: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad lha dang / tshangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i gnas pa'i mal cha'i bde ba sbyar ba'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha sbyin no //🔽stan 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can @281a *//
analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad lha dang / tshangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i gnas pa'i mal cha'i bde ba sbyar ba'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha sbyin no // stan 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can @281a *//
translated: To those who want bedding, he gives bedding in order to obtain the power to provide the bliss of bedding of the gods, Brahmā, and the noble abodes for all sentient beings.

original: thams cad byang chub kyi snying por bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bar du gcod pa thams cad kyis mi phyed par dpa' ba'i stan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan sbyin no //
analyzed: thams cad byang chub kyi snying por bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bar du gcod pa thams cad kyis mi phyed par dpa' ba'i stan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan sbyin no //
translated: To those who want seats, he gives seats in order to obtain the power of a seat that is invincible to all the obstacles of Māra and the afflictions on the seat of awakening of all sentient beings.

original: gnas 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad skyabs dang / gnas dang / mgon dang / dpung gnyen du gyur pa'i lus thob par bya ba'i phyir gnas sbyin no //
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad skyabs dang / gnas dang / mgon dang / dpung gnyen du gyur pa'i lus thob par bya ba'i phyir gnas sbyin no //
translated: To those who desire a home, I give a home, so that they may obtain a body that is a refuge, a home, a protection, and a friend for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire a water-pot, a vessel, or a tool, I give a water-pot, a vessel, and a tool, so that they may obtain a body that is a pond of Dharma for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire a forest grove, I give a forest grove, so that they may obtain a body that is a forest grove for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire a monastery, I give a monastery, so that they may obtain a body that is a monastery for all sentient beings.

original: phru tog dang / bum pa dang / 'tshog chas 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad chos kyi rdzing lta bu'i lus thob par bya ba'i phyir phru tog dang / bum pa dang / 'tshogs chas sbyin no; ;sems can thams cad zhi ba dang /
analyzed: phru tog dang / bum pa dang / 'tshog chas 'dod pa rnams la ni sems can thams cad chos kyi rdzing lta bu'i lus thob par bya ba'i phyir phru tog dang / bum pa dang / 'tshogs chas sbyin no; ;sems can thams cad zhi ba dang /
translated: To those who desire a Buddha-field, I give a Buddha-field, so that they may obtain a body that is a Buddha-field for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire a Buddha, I give a Buddha, so that they may obtain a body that is a Buddha for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire the Dharma, I give the Dharma, so that they may obtain a body that is the Dharma for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire the Sangha, I give the Sangha, so that they may obtain a body that is the Sangha for all sentient beings.

original: nye bar zhi ba bla na med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la dka' thub kyi nags tshal sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba bla na med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la dka' thub kyi nags tshal sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: To those who desire the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha, I give the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha, so that they may obtain a body that is the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire the perfections, I give the perfections, so that they may obtain a body that is the perfections for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, and the emptiness of both inner and outer, I give the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, and the emptiness of both inner and outer, so that they may obtain a body that is the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, and the emptiness of both inner and outer for all sentient beings.🔽To those who desire the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, and the emptiness of the conditioned, I give the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, and the emptiness of the conditioned, so that they may obtain a body that is the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, and the emptiness of the conditioned for all

original: sems can thams cad skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu thob par bya ba'i phyir mchod rten rnams la rgyan sbyin pa sbyin no //🔽sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan mtha' yas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir mun khrod kyi mchod rten nam /
analyzed: sems can thams cad skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu thob par bya ba'i phyir mchod rten rnams la rgyan sbyin pa sbyin no // sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan mtha' yas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir mun khrod kyi mchod rten nam /
translated: One should give ornaments for the caityas in order that all beings may obtain the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor characteristics of the Great Man.

original: lam rnams la mar me sbyin pa sbyin no //🔽sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan mtha' yas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas la mchod pa rnams sam /🔽chos la mchod @281b pa rnams sam /
analyzed: lam rnams la mar me sbyin pa sbyin no // sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan mtha' yas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas la mchod pa rnams sam / chos la mchod @281b pa rnams sam /
translated: One should give lamps for the caityas in the darkness and lamps for the roads in order that all beings may obtain the infinite divine eye of the Tathagata.

original: dge 'dun la mchod pa rnams la rol mo'i dbyangs sgra'i sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun la mchod pa rnams la rol mo'i dbyangs sgra'i sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: One should give music for the worship of the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha in order that all beings may obtain the infinite divine ear of the Tathagata.

original: sems can thams cad cha byad dang / tshul khrims dang / spyod pa mdzes pa bla na med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lhung bzed dang / chos gos sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad cha byad dang / tshul khrims dang / spyod pa mdzes pa bla na med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lhung bzed dang / chos gos sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: I will give the gift of the begging-bowl and the religious robe in order that all beings may attain the incomparable beauty of character, morality, and conduct.

original: sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba sbyin pa'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir snod chags sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba sbyin pa'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir snod chags sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: I will give the gift of vessels in order that all beings may attain the strength of the gift of relief.

original: sems can thams cad shes rab chen po'i tshogs yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir smyu gu dang / snag tsha dang / glegs bu dang / chos kyi khri stan sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad shes rab chen po'i tshogs yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir smyu gu dang / snag tsha dang / glegs bu dang / chos kyi khri stan sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: I will give the gift of pens, ink, paper, and a seat for writing the Dharma in order that all beings may attain the fulfillment of the accumulation of great wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: I will give the gift of medicine and provisions for the sick in order to cure all the sicknesses of all beings.

original: sems can thams cad byang chub rnam pa gsum gyis dang / bdud rtsi dbyings kyis thob par bya ba'i phyir sa gzhi sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad byang chub rnam pa gsum gyis dang / bdud rtsi dbyings kyis thob par bya ba'i phyir sa gzhi sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: I will give the gift of land in order that all beings may attain the three kinds of enlightenment and the nectar of immortality.

original: sems can thams cad slob dpon med pa'i chos mthon po thob par bya ba'i phyir mchod rten mthon po dang / sku gzugs mthon po byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad slob dpon med pa'i chos mthon po thob par bya ba'i phyir mchod rten mthon po dang / sku gzugs mthon po byed do //
translated: They build high reliquaries and high images in order that all beings may attain the lofty Dharma without a teacher.

original: bdog pa lta na sems can thams cad mngon par shes pa myur ba thob par bya ba'i phyir myur zhing yongs su nyon mongs par ma gyur par sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: bdog pa lta na sems can thams cad mngon par shes pa myur ba thob par bya ba'i phyir myur zhing yongs su nyon mongs par ma gyur par sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: They give gifts quickly and without being troubled in order that all beings may attain swift superknowledge.

original: sems can thams cad bar du gcod pa med par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir rung ba sbyin gyi /🔽rung ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no //🔽sems can thams cad spobs pa chen po yongs su mi 'chad pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su mi gcod @282a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad bar du gcod pa med par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir rung ba sbyin gyi / rung ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no // sems can thams cad spobs pa chen po yongs su mi 'chad pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su mi gcod @282a *//
translated: They give gifts that are suitable, not unsuitable, in order that all beings may attain complete awakening without obstruction.

original: par sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: par sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: They give gifts that are not interrupted in order that all beings may attain uninterrupted great eloquence.

original: sems can thams cad snying rje chen po mtshungs pa med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la mnyam par sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad snying rje chen po mtshungs pa med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la mnyam par sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: They give gifts equally to all beings in order that all beings may attain unequaled great compassion.

original: sems can thams cad bdud dang mu stegs byed pa thams cad kyis tshar mi chod pa dang / gnod par mi nus pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdud dang mu stegs byed pa thams cad kyis tshar mi chod pa dang / gnod par mi nus pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: I will give gifts without harming others, so that all sentient beings will attain manifest, perfect buddhahood with a body that cannot be harmed by any demon or non-Buddhist.

original: lag bzang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' la sbyin pa 'di dag sbyin du nor med cing 'byor pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: lag bzang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' la sbyin pa 'di dag sbyin du nor med cing 'byor pa med par gyur na /
translated: Subāhu, if bodhisattvas do not have the wealth to give these gifts,

original: de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la sbyin pa mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa 'di dag sbyin par yid kyis 'dod cing smon la smon lam 'debs te /
analyzed: de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la sbyin pa mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa 'di dag sbyin par yid kyis 'dod cing smon la smon lam 'debs te /
translated: they should mentally wish, aspire, and pray that all these infinite, immeasurable gifts will be given to all sentient beings in all world systems.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' de sbyin pa 'di dag byin pa'i nus pa dang ldan yang rung /🔽nus pa dang mi ldan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' de sbyin pa 'di dag byin pa'i nus pa dang ldan yang rung /🔽nus pa dang mi ldan pa yang rung ste /
translated: Subāhu, whether or not bodhisattvas have the ability to give these gifts,🔽they should give them.

original: gang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sems can thams cad bdag gi bde bar sbyar ba nyid dang ldan pa dang / yang dag par ldan par 'gyur zhing 'bad pa med pa dang 'dod pa med par brang pa rnams /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sems can thams cad bdag gi bde bar sbyar ba nyid dang ldan pa dang / yang dag par ldan par 'gyur zhing 'bad pa med pa dang 'dod pa med par brang pa rnams /
translated: May my [good] become excellent, may my [good] become virtuous, so that all sentient beings in all world-realms will be endowed with and provided with all the necessities of happiness,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du shin tu yongs su rdzogs shing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du shin tu yongs su rdzogs shing /
translated: and all of them, in every way, will be completely fulfilled,

original: bsam pa ma lus par yongs su rdzogs nas bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur bar bdag gi de bzang por gyur cig /
analyzed: bsam pa ma lus par yongs su rdzogs nas bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur bar bdag gi de bzang por gyur cig /
translated: and having completely fulfilled all their wishes, they will abide in bliss.

original: bdag @282b gi de dge bar gyur cig ces de ltar yid kyis 'dod cing smon lam smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: bdag @282b gi de dge bar gyur cig ces de ltar yid kyis 'dod cing smon lam smon lam 'debs so //
translated: Thus, he mentally desires and makes aspirational prayers.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la rin po che'i rgya mtsho yang sbyin par 'dod cing smon la smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la rin po che'i rgya mtsho yang sbyin par 'dod cing smon la smon lam 'debs so //
translated: He desires and makes aspirational prayers to give an ocean of jewels to all sentient beings in all world-realms.

original: dbyig gi ri dang / gser gyi ri dang / gos kyi ri dang / yo byad thams cad kyi ri dang / bza' brgya mtsho dang / btung ba rgya mtsho dang / gnas legs par byas pa /
analyzed: dbyig gi ri dang / gser gyi ri dang / gos kyi ri dang / yo byad thams cad kyi ri dang / bza' brgya mtsho dang / btung ba rgya mtsho dang / gnas legs par byas pa /
translated: the mountains of jewels, the mountains of gold, the mountains of clothes, the mountains of all necessities, the oceans of food, the oceans of drink, the well-made,

original: legs par gnas pa /
analyzed: legs par gnas pa /
translated: well-established,

original: mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa dag kyang sbyin par 'dod cing smon la smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa dag kyang sbyin par 'dod cing smon la smon lam 'debs so //
translated: infinite, and immeasurable abodes.

original: 'khor ba'i srid pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par gtong ba gang yin pa zang zing sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i srid pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par gtong ba gang yin pa zang zing sbyin pa'am /
translated: He aspires to and makes prayers for all the giving, relinquishing, and complete giving of all beings in all worldly realms in all existences of saṃsāra, whether past, future, or present, whether giving material things,

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'am /
translated: giving fearlessness,

original: chos sbyin pa ma lus pa de dag thams cad la tha na dus gsum du yang mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa ma lus pa de dag thams cad la tha na dus gsum du yang mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: or giving the Dharma. He rejoices in all of it, even for just a moment in the three times.

original: gal te de la bslangs la nor sbyin mi nus na yang rang gi zos skal sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: gal te de la bslangs la nor sbyin mi nus na yang rang gi zos skal sbyin pa'am /
translated: If he is unable to give him wealth, he gives him his own share of food.

original: grogs su 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: grogs su 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or he becomes his friend.

original: kun du btsal ba'i thabs kyang de la ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun du btsal ba'i thabs kyang de la ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or he shows him the means of searching for it.

original: chos kyi gtam gyis de'i 'dod pa sel bar byed do //🔽de sbyin par 'dod par gyur pa na yang sbyin pa de sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang / sems can @283a *//
analyzed: chos kyi gtam gyis de'i 'dod pa sel bar byed do // de sbyin par 'dod par gyur pa na yang sbyin pa de sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang / sems can @283a *//
translated: And he satisfies his desire with a discourse on the Dharma.

original: thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: When he has the desire to give, he dedicates that giving to unexcelled, perfect enlightenment, in order to liberate all beings, in order to free all beings, in order to bring relief to all beings, in order to take across all beings, in order to take hold of all beings, in order to purify all beings, in order to bring all beings to nirvana, in order to attain omniscience, and in order to complete all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sbyin pa dag byin nas kyang sbyin pa de sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa dag byin nas kyang sbyin pa de sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang /
translated: Having given the gift, they dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of liberating all sentient beings, for the sake of freeing all sentient beings, for the sake of comforting all sentient beings, for the sake of bringing all sentient beings to nirvana, for the sake of attaining omniscience,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: and for the sake of completing all buddhadharmas.

original: gal te sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par gtong ba de la slob pa'i nus pa dang mi ldan par gyur na de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par gtong ba de la slob pa'i nus pa dang mi ldan par gyur na de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “If they are not able to train in giving, giving up, and giving away, they should train correctly in this way:

original: dus dus su'am /
analyzed: dus dus su'am /
translated: ‘From time to time🔽I will give up, remove, and get rid of attachment, stinginess, and fear of giving.’

original: cung zad cung zad du yang chags pa dang / ser sna dang / sbyin pas 'jigs pa spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar rtsol lo //
analyzed: cung zad cung zad du yang chags pa dang / ser sna dang / sbyin pas 'jigs pa spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar rtsol lo //
translated: They should make an effort and strive

original: 'bad do // dus dus su'am /
analyzed: 'bad do // dus dus su'am /
translated: from time to time

original: cung zad cung zad du yang sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par gtong ba la slob pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rtsol lo //
analyzed: cung zad cung zad du yang sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par gtong ba la slob pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rtsol lo //
translated: They train in giving, giving up, and giving away, and they strive, exert, and make effort to increase, perfect, and complete [these acts].

original: 'bad do // srid pa gzhan du gyur pa na yang zhum par mi 'gyur zhing skyid lug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bad do // srid pa gzhan du gyur pa na yang zhum par mi 'gyur zhing skyid lug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when they are reborn in other existences, they do not become discouraged or disheartened.

original: lag bzang / byang @283b chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag sbyin pa chen po dang /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang @283b chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag sbyin pa chen po dang /
translated: Subāhu, the bodhisattvas’ arousing of the mind of awakening, their recollection of the mind of awakening, their cultivation of the mind of awakening, their aspiration to awakening, and their prayers of aspiration to awakening are themselves their great generosity,

original: gtong ba chen po dang / rnam par gtong ba chen po grangs med cing dpag tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: gtong ba chen po dang / rnam par gtong ba chen po grangs med cing dpag tu med pa yin no //
translated: their great giving up, and their great giving away, which are innumerable and limitless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di lta ste; 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la dam pa'i chos kyi char sbyin par 'dod pa dang / bdud rtsi'i dbyings kyi char sbyin par 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi char gtong bar 'dod pa dang / bdud rtsi'i dbyings kyi char gtong bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la dam pa'i chos kyi char sbyin par 'dod pa dang / bdud rtsi'i dbyings kyi char sbyin par 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi char gtong bar 'dod pa dang / bdud rtsi'i dbyings kyi char gtong bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: It is the wish to rain down the Dharma upon all beings in all world systems, to rain down the nectar of the Dharma, to let fall the rain of the Dharma, to let fall the rain of the nectar of the Dharma,🔽to let fall the rain of the Dharma, and to let fall the rain of the nectar of the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi char rnam par gtong bar 'dod pa dang / bdud rtsi'i dbyings kyi char rnam par gtong bar 'dod pa de ni sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par gtong ba thams cad kyi nang na mchog yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi char rnam par gtong bar 'dod pa dang / bdud rtsi'i dbyings kyi char rnam par gtong bar 'dod pa de ni sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par gtong ba thams cad kyi nang na mchog yin no //
translated: This is the supreme among all gifts, all let-goings, and all let-fallings.

original: de ni dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dam pa yin no //
translated: This is the best.

original: lag bzang / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bde ba dang ldan la yid bde ba dang ldan zhing tshegs chung du dang / sdug bsngal chung dus myur du skyen par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: lag bzang / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bde ba dang ldan la yid bde ba dang ldan zhing tshegs chung du dang / sdug bsngal chung dus myur du skyen par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Subāhu, in this way, the bodhisattva is happy, has mental satisfaction, and with little difficulty and little suffering, quickly and swiftly perfects the perfection of generosity.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba rnams kyis bslangs pa na yan lag dang nying lag gcod dam /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba rnams kyis bslangs pa na yan lag dang nying lag gcod dam /
translated: Subāhu, when bodhisattvas are asked by beggars, they do not cut off their major and minor body parts

original: bcad nas slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: bcad nas slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: and give them to the beggars.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag nyid kyi sems can dmyal ba chen por @284a *//
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi sems can dmyal ba chen por @284a *//
translated: Because they would become great hell beings

original: 'gyur ba dang / mi dge ba'i las chen po rgya che ba yongs su ma sdod ba'i phyir ro //🔽sems can gzhan gyi phyir ram /
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang / mi dge ba'i las chen po rgya che ba yongs su ma sdod ba'i phyir ro // sems can gzhan gyi phyir ram /
translated: and would not avoid great, extensive, nonvirtuous actions.🔽It is not that they do not give their major and minor body parts for the sake of other sentient beings

original: sems can gzhan gyi ched la de rang gi yan lag dang nying lag yongs su mi gtong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi ched la de rang gi yan lag dang nying lag yongs su mi gtong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: or for the benefit of other sentient beings.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni slong bas bdog pa thams cad bslangs na pha ma la gnod pa byas shing spangs te sdug bsngal bar byas /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni slong bas bdog pa thams cad bslangs na pha ma la gnod pa byas shing spangs te sdug bsngal bar byas /
translated: Subāhu, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva is asked by a beggar for all his possessions, he does not give them, having harmed, abandoned, and caused suffering to his parents,

original: bu dang / chung ma dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba la gnod pa byas shing spangs te sdug bsngal bar byas nas; bdog pa thams cad slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: bu dang / chung ma dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba la gnod pa byas shing spangs te sdug bsngal bar byas nas; bdog pa thams cad slong ba rnams la sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: or having harmed, abandoned, and caused suffering to his sons, wife, male slaves, female slaves, workers, and servants.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la mtshungs par snying brtse ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la mtshungs par snying brtse ba yin te /
translated: A bodhisattva has compassion for all beings equally.

original: ji ltar pha ma la gnod pa mi byed cing mi spong la sdug bsngal bar yang mi byed pa dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba la gnod pa mi byed cing mi spong ste /
analyzed: ji ltar pha ma la gnod pa mi byed cing mi spong la sdug bsngal bar yang mi byed pa dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba la gnod pa mi byed cing mi spong ste /
translated: He does not harm, abandon, or cause suffering to his parents, nor does he harm, abandon, or cause suffering to his sons, wife, male slaves, female slaves, workers, or servants.

original: sdug bsngal bar mi byed par sbyin pa yang sbyin pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la mtshungs par gso bar byed do //🔽de ni sems can gzhan gyi phyir ram /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar mi byed par sbyin pa yang sbyin pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la mtshungs par gso bar byed do // de ni sems can gzhan gyi phyir ram /
translated: He is the same in helping all sentient beings.

original: sems can gzhan gyi ched la bdog pa thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi ched la bdog pa thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: He does not fail to give up all his possessions for the sake of other sentient beings.

original: lag bzang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa'i bsngags pa gsung ba @284b ma yin na /
analyzed: lag bzang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa'i bsngags pa gsung ba @284b ma yin na /
translated: Subāhu, the Tathāgatas do not praise giving that causes harm to sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yan lag bcad pa lta la de ltar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yan lag bcad pa lta la de ltar ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that bodhisattvas cut off their limbs?

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /🔽lag bzang / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni srog gi phyir yang srog chags gzhan dag dang / sems can gzhan rnams la mi brdeg /

original: mi gsod cing /

analyzed: rdzun smra ba la rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //

analyzed: gcod du @285a *// 'jug pa dag spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar 'bad pa byed do //

analyzed: de de ltar bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po dag la ring du gnas shing brtan por gnas la dam por gnas te mi lhod par gnas shing bsgrub po //

translated: In the same way, he will strive to avoid divisive speech, harsh speech, and idle talk, and to give up, remove, and abandon them.

translated: The morality of praising the qualities of the Buddha is

original: 'phags pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i dge 'dun gyi g-yog 'khor chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i dge 'dun gyi g-yog 'khor chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for the sake of obtaining the great assembly of the Saṅgha, which possesses the qualities of the noble ones.

original: de'i 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams la dus gsum du yan lag lngas gtugs te phyag 'tshal bar byed pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams la dus gsum du yan lag lngas gtugs te phyag 'tshal bar byed pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: It is the morality of bowing down to the Buddhas of the past, present, and future, to the Dharma, to the Sangha, and to the Bodhisattvas of all the world systems, bowing down with the five parts of the body, in the three times, without limit, without measure.

original: sems can thams cad dpa' bo'i stan byang chub kyi snying por mi phyed cing sra la shin tu brtan pa'i dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab mchog gi chos nyid dam pa lnga thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dpa' bo'i stan byang chub kyi snying por mi phyed cing sra la shin tu brtan pa'i dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab mchog gi chos nyid dam pa lnga thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the morality of causing all beings to attain the five supreme dharmas, which are the qualities of the hero’s seat of enlightenment: unshakable faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de'i dus gsum du sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i tshul khrims ni; sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus gsum du sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten thams cad la rim gro byed pa'i tshul khrims ni; sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the morality of serving all the caityas of the Buddhas of the three times, in order to attain the fulfillment of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de'i dus gsum du chos kyi yon tan brjod pa smra ba'i tshul khrims ni chos kyi 'khor lo gnas med @287b pa bla na med pa bskor ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i dus gsum du dge 'dun gyi yon tan brjod pa smra ba'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i dus gsum du chos kyi yon tan brjod pa smra ba'i tshul khrims ni chos kyi 'khor lo gnas med @287b pa bla na med pa bskor ba'i phyir ro // de'i dus gsum du dge 'dun gyi yon tan brjod pa smra ba'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of speaking of the good qualities of the Dharma in the three times is in order to turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma without a place to stand.

original: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun mi phyed pa'i g-yog 'khor chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i dus gsum du dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun mi phyed pa'i g-yog 'khor chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir ro // de'i dus gsum du dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of speaking of the good qualities of the Saṅgha in the three times is in order to obtain the great retinue of followers of the noble Saṅgha that is not divided.

original: sems can thams cad la skyabs bla na med pa sbyin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i dus gsum du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad dkon mchog gsum dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis stongs par mi 'gyur bar gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la skyabs bla na med pa sbyin pa'i phyir ro // de'i dus gsum du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad dkon mchog gsum dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis stongs par mi 'gyur bar gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of going for refuge to the Three Jewels in the three times is in order to give unsurpassed protection to all sentient beings.

original: bde bar 'gyur ba gcig tu nges par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur ba gcig tu nges par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The morality of praying that all world systems in the three times will never be empty of the Three Jewels and bodhisattvas is in order to attain the definite goodness of complete enlightenment.

original: de'i dus gsum du sangs rgyas thams cad la bskal par chos ston par gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i dus gsum du sangs rgyas thams cad la bskal par chos ston par gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of requesting all the Buddhas of the three times to teach the Dharma for an eon

original: sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is for the sake of attaining the tenth stage, the Cloud of Dharma.

original: de'i dus gsum du sdig pa thams cad so sor 'chags pa dang / sdig pa thams cad so sor 'dor ba dang / sdig pa thams cad la smod pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i dus gsum du sdig pa thams cad so sor 'chags pa dang / sdig pa thams cad so sor 'dor ba dang / sdig pa thams cad la smod pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of confessing all the sins of the three times, of renouncing all sins, and of condemning all sins

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par gzhom pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par gzhom pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is for the sake of attaining the complete destruction of the bonds of the propensities.

original: de'i dus gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i dus gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of taking up all the roots of virtue of the three times🔽is for the sake of attaining the fulfillment of all the perfections.🔽The morality of rejoicing in all the merits of the three times

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is for the sake of attaining the fulfillment of all the perfections.

original: de'i dus gsum du sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / @288a *//
analyzed: de'i dus gsum du sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / @288a *//
translated: The morality of requesting the Buddhas of the three times not to enter Nirvana🔽is for the sake of attaining the fulfillment of all the perfections.🔽The morality of dedicating all the roots of virtue of the three times to unsurpassable enlightenment🔽is for the sake of attaining the fulfillment of all the perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad tu gtogs pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang / sems can 'gro ba thams cad du song ba 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad tu gtogs pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang / sems can 'gro ba thams cad du song ba 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa /
translated: The morality of rejoicing in all the roots of virtue of all the Bodhisattvas who have been, who are, and who will be in all the world systems, and of all the sentient beings who have gone to all the migrations and who are in all the world systems,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: whether they are past, future, or present,

original: byang chub kyi tshogs mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa bsags pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs mtha' yas shing dpag tu med pa bsags pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is in order to complete the accumulation of the infinite and immeasurable requisites for enlightenment.

original: de'i dus gsum du rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i dus gsum du rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of aspiring to complete enlightenment in the three times

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par nges pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par nges pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is in order to enter into the certainty of attaining complete enlightenment.

original: de'i dus gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i dus gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of dedicating all the roots of virtue of the three times to the attainment of perfect enlightenment is

original: gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to attain the powers and fearlessness of the Tathagata.

original: de'i pha ma dang / bla ma dang / rgan pa dang / slob dpon dang; mkhan po la yongs su spyad par byed pa'i bsnyen bkur byed pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i pha ma dang / bla ma dang / rgan pa dang / slob dpon dang; mkhan po la yongs su spyad par byed pa'i bsnyen bkur byed pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of serving and respecting one's parents, teachers, elders, instructors, and preceptors is

original: zil gyis mi non pa'i chos nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zil gyis mi non pa'i chos nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to attain the nature of being unassailable.

original: de'i 'jigs pa dang / skrag pa dang; nyam thag pa dang / mgon med pa dbugs 'byin pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i 'jigs pa dang / skrag pa dang; nyam thag pa dang / mgon med pa dbugs 'byin pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of comforting those who are frightened, terrified, and helpless is

original: dris pa thams cad la mi skyo bar lan 'debs pa la mkhas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dris pa thams cad la mi skyo bar lan 'debs pa la mkhas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to attain the skill of answering all questions without fatigue.

original: de'i rgyal po @288b dang; chom rkun dang / me dang / chu dang / bgo skal la spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi nang du chud pa rnams yongs su bskyab cing grogs bya ba'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyal po @288b dang; chom rkun dang / me dang / chu dang / bgo skal la spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi nang du chud pa rnams yongs su bskyab cing grogs bya ba'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of protection is the protection of those who are in the midst of the suffering of kings, thieves, fire, water, and the distribution of inheritance.

original: gnas dang / sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po yongs su bsrung ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas dang / sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po yongs su bsrung ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the attainment of the protection of the great perfections of place and ground.🔽The morality of praise is the praise of the magical power of the Buddhas, Pratyekabuddhas, noble disciples, and bodhisattvas.

original: de'i sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rjes su bsngags pa'i tshul khrims ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs bla na med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rjes su bsngags pa'i tshul khrims ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs bla na med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the attainment of the unexcelled power of magical transformation of the Tathagata.

original: de'i pha rol gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang mthun pa'i lus kyi las kyi tshul khrims dang / pha rol gyi sems mngon par dga' ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i lus kyi las kyi tshul khrims dang / pha rol gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang mthun pa'i ngag gi las kyi tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: de'i pha rol gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang mthun pa'i lus kyi las kyi tshul khrims dang / pha rol gyi sems mngon par dga' ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i lus kyi las kyi tshul khrims dang / pha rol gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang mthun pa'i ngag gi las kyi tshul khrims dang /
translated: The morality of physical action that is in conformity with the protection of the minds of others, and the morality of physical action that causes the minds of others to be greatly pleased and delighted, and the morality of verbal action that is in conformity with the protection of the minds of others,

original: pha rol gyi sems mngon par dga' ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i ngag gi las kyi tshul khrims ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol kyi sems mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems mngon par dga' ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i ngag gi las kyi tshul khrims ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol kyi sems mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the morality of verbal action that causes the minds of others to be greatly pleased and delighted, are for the sake of attaining the infinite power of the Tathagatas to know the minds of others.

original: de'i tshe 'di'i don dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi don dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i don dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i don dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi theg pa'i don rnams la bag med pa dang / brjed pa rnams kyi dran pa yang dag par bskyed pa'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di'i don dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi don dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i don dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i don dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi theg pa'i don rnams la bag med pa dang / brjed pa rnams kyi dran pa yang dag par bskyed pa'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: At that time, the morality of generating the right mindfulness of those who are heedless and forgetful with regard to the meaning of this life, the meaning of other lives, the meaning of the Disciple Vehicle, the meaning of the Solitary Buddha Vehicle, and the meaning of the Vehicle of complete enlightenment.

original: dran pa 'byung bar byed pa'i tshul @289a *//🔽khrims ni / brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa 'byung bar byed pa'i tshul @289a *// khrims ni / brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The morality of causing mindfulness to arise is

original: de'i chos nyan pa'i tshul khrims dang / chos 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims dang / chos goms par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / chos nye bar ston pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de'i chos nyan pa'i tshul khrims dang / chos 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims dang / chos goms par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / chos nye bar ston pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: the morality of listening to the Dharma, the morality of retaining the Dharma, the morality of cultivating the Dharma, and the morality of teaching the Dharma.🔽The morality of causing mindfulness to arise is the morality of listening to the Dharma, the morality of retaining the Dharma, the morality of cultivating the Dharma, and the morality of teaching the Dharma.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The morality of teaching the Dharma is for the sake of attaining the Dharma of non-forgetfulness and the perfection of eloquence.

original: de'i tshul khrims yang dag par len par 'dod pa dang / lhag par spyad par 'dod pa na yang lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de thams cad sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang /🔽sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshul khrims yang dag par len par 'dod pa dang / lhag par spyad par 'dod pa na yang lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de thams cad sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: When he wishes to take up morality and to practice it, he dedicates all the roots of virtue of his body, speech, and mind to the liberation of all beings, to the release of all beings,🔽to the solace of all beings, to the attainment of omniscience, and to the perfection of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / lhag par spyod pa dang / yang dag par blangs pa dang / lhag par spyad nas kyang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / lhag par spyod pa dang / yang dag par blangs pa dang / lhag par spyad nas kyang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
translated: He takes up, practices, and undertakes morality, and having practiced it, he liberates all beings, he releases all beings, he gives solace to all beings,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates it to the attainment of omniscience and to the completion of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: gal te tshul khrims de ma zhig pa dang / ma ral ba dang / 'dren ma ma yin par slob pa'i nus pa dang mi ldan par @289b gyur na /
analyzed: gal te tshul khrims de ma zhig pa dang / ma ral ba dang / 'dren ma ma yin par slob pa'i nus pa dang mi ldan par @289b gyur na /
translated: If he is not able to train in that morality without breaking it, without tearing it, without being stained by it,

original: de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /🔽dus dus su'am /
analyzed: de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste / dus dus su'am /
translated: he trains himself thus:

original: cung zad cung zad du yang mi dge ba spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar rtsol lo //
analyzed: cung zad cung zad du yang mi dge ba spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar rtsol lo //
translated: “From time to time I will strive to abandon, to reject, to remove unwholesome thoughts that have arisen.

original: 'bad do / dus dus su'am /
analyzed: 'bad do / dus dus su'am /
translated: I will make an effort.

original: cung zad cung zad du yang dge ba la slob pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rtsol lo //
analyzed: cung zad cung zad du yang dge ba la slob pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rtsol lo //
translated: From time to time I will strive to cultivate, to develop, to perfect wholesome thoughts that have arisen.🔽I will make an effort.

original: 'bad do // srid pa gzhan du gyur pa na yang zhum par mi 'gyur zhing sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bad do // srid pa gzhan du gyur pa na yang zhum par mi 'gyur zhing sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if I am reborn in another existence, I will not be discouraged or disheartened.”

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu son pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa gang yin 'di nyid de dag gi dge ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu son pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa gang yin 'di nyid de dag gi dge ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Subāhu, this is the bodhisattvas’ generation of the mind of awakening, the recollection of the mind of awakening, the cultivation of the mind of awakening, the attainment of awakening, and the aspiration for awakening.🔽

original: dge ba'i tshul khrims la lhag par spyod pa grangs med cing dpag tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i tshul khrims la lhag par spyod pa grangs med cing dpag tu med pa yin no //
translated: Subāhu, the bodhisattvas’ generation of the mind of awakening, their recollection of the mind of awakening, their cultivation of the mind of awakening, their attainment of awakening, and their aspiration for awakening—all of this is their practice of and engagement in the superior discipline of virtue, which is beyond number and measure.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i tshul khrims bskyed par 'dod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i tshul khrims bskyed par 'dod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa dang /
translated: It is because they wish to generate the untainted discipline in all sentient beings in all world systems, they wish to generate the discipline of no more learning, they wish to generate the untainted discipline,

original: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa de ni dge ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / dge ba'i tshul khrims lhag par spyod pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa de ni dge ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / dge ba'i tshul khrims lhag par spyod pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: He who wishes to generate the morality of the non-learner is one who takes up the morality of virtue and is foremost in the practice of the morality of virtue.

original: de ni dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dam pa yin no //
translated: He is the best.

original: lag bzang / de ltar na byang chub @290a *//
analyzed: lag bzang / de ltar na byang chub @290a *//

analyzed: bdog pa thams cad 'phrog gam /

analyzed: chung ma 'phrog gam /

translated: He does not respond with any of these.🔽He does not respond with anger to anger,🔽with harm to harm,🔽with slander to slander,🔽with beating to beating,🔽with threat to threat,

analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Subāhu, moreover, a bodhisattva trains correctly in the following way:

analyzed: gal te bdag gi srog @290b gcod pa'am /

analyzed: bdog pa thams cad 'phrog pa'am /

original: chung ma 'phrog pa'am /🔽brdzun du smra ba'am /
analyzed: chung ma 'phrog pa'am / brdzun du smra ba'am /

analyzed: phra ma'am / ngag rtsub po'am /

analyzed: gzhan dag la slar gnod pa byas sam /

analyzed: slar khro ba'am /

original: shar gnyer zhing khon du bzung na slar gnod pa byas pa dang / slar khros pa dang / shar gnyer zhing 'khon du bzung ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba de'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba mi 'dod pa /

translated: I do not want the painful feelings

original: mi sdug pa /🔽yid du mi 'ong ba 'dis bdag la las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / las kyi rgyu mthun pa brgya 'gyur ram /
analyzed: mi sdug pa / yid du mi 'ong ba 'dis bdag la las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / las kyi rgyu mthun pa brgya 'gyur ram /
translated: that are unpleasant and disagreeable🔽that would ripen for me as the result of that nonvirtuous act,🔽or the hundreds of thousands of times

original: stong 'gyur ram /
analyzed: stong 'gyur ram /
translated: that would be the natural outcome of that act.

original: de bas lhag par mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i sdug bsngal gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: de bas lhag par mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i sdug bsngal gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: and even more, other sufferings that are undesirable, unpleasant, and disagreeable will occur.”

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subāhu, a bodhisattva should train correctly as follows:

original: srog yod pas srog gcod par 'gyur /
analyzed: srog yod pas srog gcod par 'gyur /
translated: Since there is life, there will be killing.

original: rdzas yod pas rdzas 'phrog par 'gyur /
analyzed: rdzas yod pas rdzas 'phrog par 'gyur /

original: rna ba'i dbang po yod pas brdzun du smra ba thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po yod pas brdzun du smra ba thos par 'gyur /

original: phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa thos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa thos par 'gyur la /
translated: There will be hearing slander, harsh words, and idle speech.

original: lus yod pas 'dren pa dang / 'chi ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / brdeg pa dang / gcod par 'gyur te /🔽bdag nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi dngos po /🔽sdug bsngal gyi gzhi /
analyzed: lus yod pas 'dren pa dang / 'chi ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / brdeg pa dang / gcod par 'gyur te / bdag nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi dngos po / sdug bsngal gyi gzhi /
translated: Since there is a body, there will be leading, dying, grasping, beating, and cutting.🔽Since one has taken up the faculty of life, the faculty of hearing, and the body, which are the basis of suffering,

original: srog gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / lus blangs par gyur na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / lus blangs par gyur na /
translated: the basis of pain,🔽the basis of what is undesirable, unpleasant, and disagreeable,🔽how could one harm others in return,

original: ji ltar gzhan dag la slar gnod pa dang / slar khro @291a *//
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag la slar gnod pa dang / slar khro @291a *//
translated: how could one be angry in return,🔽how could one retaliate in return?”

original: ba'am / shar gnyer zhing 'khon du bzung bar bya snyam mo //
analyzed: ba'am / shar gnyer zhing 'khon du bzung bar bya snyam mo //
translated: I will not be angry or hold a grudge.

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subāhu, the bodhisattva should train correctly as follows:

original: dper na / sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ni sra ba ste /🔽de ni ngo bo nyid /🔽de ni chos nyid /
analyzed: dper na / sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ni sra ba ste / de ni ngo bo nyid / de ni chos nyid /

original: de ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin no //
translated: That is its intrinsic nature.

original: chu'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ni gsher ba /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ni gsher ba /

original: me'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ni tsha ba /
analyzed: me'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ni tsha ba /

analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi mtshan nyid ni yang zhing g-yo ba ste / de ni ngo bo nyid /

original: de ni chos nyid /
analyzed: de ni chos nyid /
translated: That is its nature.

original: de ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin no //
translated: That is its intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du srog thams cad kyang zad pa'i chos can /
analyzed: de bzhin du srog thams cad kyang zad pa'i chos can /

original: 'god pa'i chos can /
analyzed: 'god pa'i chos can /

analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos can no // dbang po thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyi chos can / sdug bsngal 'dus te reg pa'i chos can /

original: sdug bsngal myong ba'i chos can /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba'i chos can /
translated: and subject to the experience of suffering.

original: lus thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyi chos /🔽sdug bsngal 'dus te reg pa'i chos /
analyzed: lus thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyi chos / sdug bsngal 'dus te reg pa'i chos /

original: sdug bsngal myong ba'i chos te /🔽de ni ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba'i chos te / de ni ngo bo nyid /
translated: It is a phenomenon of the experience of suffering.🔽This is its essence.

original: de ni chos nyid /
analyzed: de ni chos nyid /
translated: This is its nature.

original: de ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin no //
translated: This is its intrinsic nature.

original: srog gi dbang po zad pa'i chos can /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po zad pa'i chos can /
translated: It is a phenomenon of the exhaustion of the life faculty.

original: 'god pa'i chos can /🔽'gog pa'i chos can /
analyzed: 'god pa'i chos can / 'gog pa'i chos can /
translated: It is a phenomenon of being laid out.🔽It is a phenomenon of cessation.

original: zad cing dngos la 'gog pa dang / dbang po drug sdug bsngal gyi chos can /🔽sdug bsngal 'dus te reg pa'i chos can /
analyzed: zad cing dngos la 'gog pa dang / dbang po drug sdug bsngal gyi chos can / sdug bsngal 'dus te reg pa'i chos can /
translated: It is a phenomenon of the exhaustion and cessation of the six faculties.🔽It is a phenomenon of the contact of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba'i chos can rnams la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba'i chos can rnams la /
translated: It is a phenomenon of the experience of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'dus te reg pas ji ltar gzhan dag la slar gnod pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'dus te reg pas ji ltar gzhan dag la slar gnod pa'am /
translated: How could the contact of suffering cause harm to others,

original: slar khro ba'am /
analyzed: slar khro ba'am /
translated: or cause anger,

original: shar gnyer zhing 'khon du gzung bar bya /
analyzed: shar gnyer zhing 'khon du gzung bar bya /
translated: or cause resentment?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽@291b 'di ni ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / @291b 'di ni ngo bo nyid /
translated: Why is that?🔽This is its essence.

original: 'di ni chos nyid /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid /
translated: This is its nature.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin no snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin no snyam mo //
translated: This is its intrinsic nature.

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subāhu, a bodhisattva should train correctly in the following way:

original: bdag gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang bdag med cing bdag gi med pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang bdag med cing bdag gi med pa yin la /
translated: “My eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are without a self and without a self-entity.

original: gzhan dag gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang bdag med cing bdag gi med pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang bdag med cing bdag gi med pa yin na /
translated: The eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind of others are also without a self and without a self-entity.
