analyzed: mkhas pa rig pa dag mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid bdag med cing /
translated: The eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind of the wise and the learned are without a self and without a self-entity.

original: yid bdag gi med pa la mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid bdag med cing /
analyzed: yid bdag gi med pa la mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid bdag med cing /
translated: The eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind of the wise and the learned are without a self and without a self-entity.

original: bdag gi med pas ji ltar dga' ba'am /
analyzed: bdag gi med pas ji ltar dga' ba'am /
translated: How could they delight in,

original: rjes su chags pa'am /🔽yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'am / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: be attached to,

original: brdeg pa'am / slar gnod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: brdeg pa'am / slar gnod par byed pa'am /
translated: or rejoice in the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind?🔽How could they beat, harm,

original: slar khro ba'am /
analyzed: slar khro ba'am /
translated: or be angry with them?

original: shar gnyer zhing 'khon du 'dzin par 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: shar gnyer zhing 'khon du 'dzin par 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: How could they be spiteful and hold grudges?”

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar slob ste /
translated: “Moreover, Supuṣpacandra, bodhisattvas should train as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mir skye ba'i sdug bsngal ni nyung zhing chung gi /
analyzed: mir skye ba'i sdug bsngal ni nyung zhing chung gi /
translated: The suffering of being born as a human is small and slight.

original: yi dvags kyi sdug bsngal ni ches mi bzad la ches bzod par dka' ba yin /
analyzed: yi dvags kyi sdug bsngal ni ches mi bzad la ches bzod par dka' ba yin /
translated: The suffering of being born as a hungry ghost is extremely unbearable and difficult to endure.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang ches mi bzad cing bzod par dka' ba yin na /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang ches mi bzad cing bzod par dka' ba yin na /
translated: The suffering of being born as an animal and the suffering of being born in the hells are also extremely unbearable and difficult to endure.

original: bdag gis ji ltar sdug bsngal chung zhing nyung ba tsam gyi phyir gzhan dag la slar gnod pa dang / slar khro ba dang / shar gnyer @292a *//
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar sdug bsngal chung zhing nyung ba tsam gyi phyir gzhan dag la slar gnod pa dang / slar khro ba dang / shar gnyer @292a *//
translated: So how could I, for the sake of just a little bit of small suffering, harm others in return, be angry in return,

original: zhing 'khon du gzung bar bya snyam mo //
analyzed: zhing 'khon du gzung bar bya snyam mo //
translated: and hold grudges and bear malice?”

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subāhu, a bodhisattva should train correctly in the following way:

original: gang bdag gcig pu'i don 'dod pa dang / bdag gcig pu la phan par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gang bdag gcig pu'i don 'dod pa dang / bdag gcig pu la phan par 'dod pas /
translated: ‘It is not right for me, who desires my own benefit and seeks my own happiness,

original: gzhan dag la phyir gnod par byed cing phyir khro ste /🔽shar gnyer zhing khon du 'dzin pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la phyir gnod par byed cing phyir khro ste /🔽shar gnyer zhing khon du 'dzin pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: to harm others in return, be angry in return,🔽and hold grudges and bear malice.’

original: cha ma yin na bdag 'jig rten thams cad kyi don 'dod pa /
analyzed: cha ma yin na bdag 'jig rten thams cad kyi don 'dod pa /
translated: If you are not a part of it, then what need is there to speak of those who desire the welfare of the whole world,

original: 'jig rten thams cad la phan par 'dod pa /🔽go cha chen po bgos pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la phan par 'dod pa / go cha chen po bgos pa /
translated: who desire to benefit the whole world,🔽who are clad in great armor,

original: yid dam bcas pa chen pos yid dam bcas pa /
analyzed: yid dam bcas pa chen pos yid dam bcas pa /
translated: who have made a great vow,

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa /
translated: who have set out in the Great Vehicle,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po yongs su bskang bar 'dod pa lta la smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po yongs su bskang bar 'dod pa lta la smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: and who desire to fulfill the vast Buddha qualities?

original: mi bzod pa dang / phyir gnod pa byed pa dang / phyir khro ba dang / shar gnyer zhing 'khon du 'dzin pas ni /
analyzed: mi bzod pa dang / phyir gnod pa byed pa dang / phyir khro ba dang / shar gnyer zhing 'khon du 'dzin pas ni /
translated: “ ‘Those who are intolerant, who retaliate, who get angry, who are spiteful and hold grudges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag gsog pa dang / 'phel ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag gsog pa dang / 'phel ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: will not accumulate, increase, and perfect these qualities of the Buddha.

original: gzod pa dang / phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang / phyir mi khro ba dang / shar gnyer zhing 'khon du 'dzin pa mi byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag gsog cing 'phel te yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: gzod pa dang / phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang / phyir mi khro ba dang / shar gnyer zhing 'khon du 'dzin pa mi byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag gsog cing 'phel te yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: Those who are patient, who do not retaliate, who do not get angry, who are not spiteful and do not hold grudges, will accumulate, increase, and perfect these qualities of the Buddha.’🔽“

original: lag bzang / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: lag bzang / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Subāhu, a son or daughter of noble family

original: rigs kyi bu mo sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bskang bar 'dod pas /🔽mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal gyi reg pas reg kyang gzhan dag la slar @292b gnod par mi bya /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bskang bar 'dod pas / mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal gyi reg pas reg kyang gzhan dag la slar @292b gnod par mi bya /
translated: who wishes to perfect the qualities of the Buddha

original: slar khro bar mi bya /
analyzed: slar khro bar mi bya /
translated: should not harm others or become angry with them even if they are touched by the suffering of the Avīci hell.

original: shar gnyer zhing 'khon du gzung bar mi bya na mi'i sdug bsngal gyis reg pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: shar gnyer zhing 'khon du gzung bar mi bya na mi'i sdug bsngal gyis reg pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: They should not be spiteful or hold grudges, let alone be touched by the suffering of humans.

original: de spyos sam /
analyzed: de spyos sam /
translated: Even if they are reviled,

original: brgyad dam / smad dam /
analyzed: brgyad dam / smad dam /
translated: slandered, disparaged,

original: mi snyan pa byas kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs shin tu dri ma med cing dag la dkar ba thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no; ;de drud bshal tam /
analyzed: mi snyan pa byas kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs shin tu dri ma med cing dag la dkar ba thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no; ;de drud bshal tam /
translated: or treated with contempt, they should be patient and accept it all in order to attain the Tathāgata’s mind, which is extremely pure, clean, and bright, and to develop a loving mind, a compassionate mind, and a mind of great compassion.

original: bcings sam / bzung yang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / skad cig gcig la ma rig pa'i sgrib pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs gzhom pa'i phyir bzod cing dang du len to //
analyzed: bcings sam / bzung yang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / skad cig gcig la ma rig pa'i sgrib pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs gzhom pa'i phyir bzod cing dang du len to //
translated: Even if he is bound or imprisoned, he is patient and persevering in order to destroy the shell of ignorance in a single instant, with a mind of love and a mind of compassion.

original: de brdegs kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'chags pa dang / khong khro ba bzlog pa'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //🔽de rna ba bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad la dad par bya ba'i chos kyi rna ba bskyed pa'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
analyzed: de brdegs kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'chags pa dang / khong khro ba bzlog pa'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no // de rna ba bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad la dad par bya ba'i chos kyi rna ba bskyed pa'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
translated: Even if he is beaten, he is patient and persevering in order to confess his faults to all sentient beings and to turn them away from anger, with a mind of love and a mind of compassion.🔽Even if his ears are cut off, he is patient and persevering in order to generate the Dharma ear of faith in all sentient beings, with a mind of love and a mind of compassion.

original: de sna bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad tshul khrims kyi yon tan mdzes shing /
analyzed: de sna bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad tshul khrims kyi yon tan mdzes shing /
translated: Even if his nose is cut off, he is patient and persevering in order to generate the nose of moral discipline in all sentient beings, with a mind of love and a mind of compassion.

original: bla na med pa la longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
analyzed: bla na med pa la longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
translated: He is patient and tolerant in order to enjoy the unsurpassed.

original: de rkang pa bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //🔽de lag @293a *//
analyzed: de rkang pa bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no // de lag @293a *//
translated: He is patient and tolerant in order to attain the four bases of miraculous power of the Tathagata, with a mind of love and a mind of compassion, even when his feet are cut off.

original: pa bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad la zhi ba dang nye bar zhi ba'i chos kyi lag pa sbyin pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
analyzed: pa bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad la zhi ba dang nye bar zhi ba'i chos kyi lag pa sbyin pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
translated: He is patient and tolerant in order to attain the hand of the Dharma of peace and tranquility for all sentient beings, with a mind of love and a mind of compassion, even when his hands are cut off.

original: de yan lag thams cad bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yan lag dang nying lag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
analyzed: de yan lag thams cad bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yan lag dang nying lag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
translated: He is patient and tolerant in order to attain the perfection of all the major and minor limbs of the six perfections, with a mind of love and a mind of compassion, even when all his limbs are cut off.

original: de'i mig phyung yang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad shes bzhin gyi mig g-yung drung thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //🔽de mgo bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos kyi mgo thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
analyzed: de'i mig phyung yang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad shes bzhin gyi mig g-yung drung thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no // de mgo bcad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos kyi mgo thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod cing dang du len no //
translated: Even if his eyes are gouged out, he is patient and endures it, with a mind of love, a mind of compassion, and the thought, “May all sentient beings attain the eye of wisdom.”🔽Even if his head is cut off, he is patient and endures it, with a mind of love, a mind of compassion, and the thought, “May all sentient beings attain the head of omniscience.”

original: de bzod pa 'di dag dang / ji mi snyam pa 'di dag mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa dang / yid la bya bar 'dod pa na yang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
analyzed: de bzod pa 'di dag dang / ji mi snyam pa 'di dag mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa dang / yid la bya bar 'dod pa na yang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
translated: “When he wishes to actualize these forbearances and these equanimities, and wishes to bring them to mind, he thinks, ‘I will liberate all sentient beings, I will liberate all sentient beings, I will bring relief to all sentient beings,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates so that all sentient beings may attain omniscience and perfect all the qualities of the Buddhas.

original: mngon sum du byed pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa dang / yid la byas nas kyang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams @293b cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa dang / yid la byas nas kyang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams @293b cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
translated: He dedicates so that all sentient beings may be liberated, so that all sentient beings may be freed, so that all sentient beings may be comforted,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: so that all sentient beings may attain omniscience, and so that all the qualities of the Buddhas may be perfected.

original: gal te bzod pa 'di dag dang / ji mi snyam pa 'di dag ma nyams pa dang / skyon med pa dang / 'dren ma ma yin par slob pa'i nus pa dang mi ldan par gyur na de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: gal te bzod pa 'di dag dang / ji mi snyam pa 'di dag ma nyams pa dang / skyon med pa dang / 'dren ma ma yin par slob pa'i nus pa dang mi ldan par gyur na de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: If he is not able to train in these forbearances and these equanimities without loss, without defect, and without impurity, he should train thus:

original: dus dus su'am /
analyzed: dus dus su'am /
translated: ‘From time to time

original: cung zad cung zad du yang mi bzod pa dang / mi snyam par ma byas pa spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar rtsol lo //🔽'bad do // dus dus su'am /
analyzed: cung zad cung zad du yang mi bzod pa dang / mi snyam par ma byas pa spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar rtsol lo // 'bad do // dus dus su'am /
translated: He does not tolerate even the slightest impatience, and he strives to abandon, to reject, and to remove any lack of consideration.

original: cung zad / cung zad du yang bzod pa dang / ji mi snyam pa la slob pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rtsol lo //
analyzed: cung zad / cung zad du yang bzod pa dang / ji mi snyam pa la slob pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rtsol lo //
translated: He makes an effort and strives to train in patience and tolerance, to increase it, and to perfect it.

original: 'bad do // srid pa gzhan du gyur pa na yang zhum par mi 'gyur zhing sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bad do // srid pa gzhan du gyur pa na yang zhum par mi 'gyur zhing sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when he is reborn in another existence, he does not become discouraged or disheartened.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi bzod pa kun tu spyod pa dge ba dang /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi bzod pa kun tu spyod pa dge ba dang /
translated: “Subāhu, the bodhisattvas’ generation of the mind of awakening, their recollection of the mind of awakening, their cultivation of the mind of awakening, their aspiration for awakening, and their prayers for awakening are the virtuous practice of their patience.

original: bzod pa yang dag par sgrub pa dge ba grangs med cing dpag tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa yang dag par sgrub pa dge ba grangs med cing dpag tu med pa yin no //
translated: The virtue of the practice of patience and the virtue of the accomplishment of patience are immeasurable and innumerable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la zag pa med pa'i bzod pa bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i @294a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la zag pa med pa'i bzod pa bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i @294a *//
translated: It is like this:

original: bzod pa bskyed par 'dod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bzod pa yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i bzod pa yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa de ni bzod pa kun tu spyad pa dge ba dang / bzod pa yang dag par bsgrub pa dge ba thams cad kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa bskyed par 'dod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bzod pa yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i bzod pa yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa de ni bzod pa kun tu spyad pa dge ba dang / bzod pa yang dag par bsgrub pa dge ba thams cad kyi mchog yin no //
translated: The desire to generate uncontaminated patience in all sentient beings in all world systems, the desire to generate the patience of no more learning, the desire to generate the uncontaminated patience, and the desire to generate the patience of no more learning—this is the supreme virtue of the practice of patience and the virtue of the accomplishment of patience.

original: de ni dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dam pa yin no //
translated: This is the highest.

original: lag bzang / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bde ba dang ldan la yid bde ba dang ldan zhing tshegs chung ngu dang / sdug bsngal chung ngus myur du skyen par bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: lag bzang / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bde ba dang ldan la yid bde ba dang ldan zhing tshegs chung ngu dang / sdug bsngal chung ngus myur du skyen par bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Subāhu, in this way, the bodhisattva is endowed with happiness, endowed with mental ease, and with little difficulty and little suffering, he quickly and swiftly perfects the perfection of patience.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
translated: Subāhu, how does the bodhisattva perfect the perfection of effort?

original: lag bzang / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Subāhu, here the bodhisattva trains correctly in this way:

original: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: In each of the ten directions there are infinite and limitless world systems.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams re re na yang sems can mtha' yas so //🔽de ltar sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mu med pa mtha' yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams re re na yang sems can mtha' yas so // de ltar sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mu med pa mtha' yod pa ma yin /
translated: In each world system there are infinite sentient beings.

original: mu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the assembly of sentient beings is infinite and limitless, not finite, not having an end.

original: bdag ni sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de la phan pa'i phyir go cha bgos la sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing /
analyzed: bdag ni sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de la phan pa'i phyir go cha bgos la sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing /
translated: I am clad in armor for the sake of the infinite and limitless mass of sentient beings.

original: mtha' yas pa la bde ba'i phyir go cha bgos na sems can thams cad la phan par dmigs pa mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa dang / sems can thams cad la bde bar dmigs pa mtha' @294b yas shing mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas pa dag bag med par gyur tam /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa la bde ba'i phyir go cha bgos na sems can thams cad la phan par dmigs pa mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa dang / sems can thams cad la bde bar dmigs pa mtha' @294b yas shing mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas pa dag bag med par gyur tam /
translated: I am clad in armor for the sake of the infinite and limitless mass of sentient beings.

original: sems gzhan du gyur tam /
analyzed: sems gzhan du gyur tam /
translated: If I were to become heedless, or if my mind were to change,

original: gnyid kyis log kyang nyin mtshan du sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la 'phel ba dang / rgyas pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyid kyis log kyang nyin mtshan du sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la 'phel ba dang / rgyas pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: even while asleep, day and night, in every moment, in every instant, my roots of virtue would increase, expand, and reach completion.

original: sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa dag skye ba dang / byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa dag skye bas rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed dka' bar mi 'gyur na /🔽bdag gis 'dir sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyas par 'gyur ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa yang dag par rjes su mthong la gzhi de las rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed mi dka' bar yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus srog
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa dag skye ba dang / byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa dag skye bas rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed dka' bar mi 'gyur na / bdag gis 'dir sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyas par 'gyur ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa yang dag par rjes su mthong la gzhi de las rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed mi dka' bar yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus srog
translated: Since in each moment of mind, infinite roots of virtue are born and infinite heaps of the accumulations for enlightenment are born, complete enlightenment is not difficult to attain.

original: gi phyir yang ci'i phyir nyams par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: gi phyir yang ci'i phyir nyams par bya snyam mo //
translated: Since in each moment of mind, I see infinite roots of virtue increasing and infinite roots of virtue expanding, and since I see that complete enlightenment is not difficult to attain on that basis, why should I let my effort decline even for the sake of my life?

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subāhu, a bodhisattva should train correctly as follows:

original: gang zhig sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de'i rga ba'i sdug bsngal gcig pu bsal ba dang gzhom par 'dod pa de yang sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa 'phel la dge ba'i🔽rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' @295a *//
analyzed: gang zhig sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de'i rga ba'i sdug bsngal gcig pu bsal ba dang gzhom par 'dod pa de yang sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa 'phel la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' @295a *//
translated: If one wishes to remove and conquer the suffering of old age of that infinite and limitless mass of sentient beings, then in each instant of mind, one’s roots of virtue will increase infinitely and limitlessly, and

original: yas pa rgyas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yas pa rgyas par 'gyur na /
translated: one’s roots of virtue will expand infinitely and limitlessly.

original: gang zhig sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de'i skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa mi 'byor ba'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: gang zhig sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de'i skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa mi 'byor ba'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: If one wishes to remove the suffering of birth of that infinite and limitless mass of sentient beings, the suffering of death, the suffering of being separated from what is pleasant, the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant, the suffering of not obtaining what one desires,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang / grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang / tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam mo //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang / grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang / tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam mo //
translated: What need is there to mention the desire to remove the suffering of the animal realm, the suffering of the world of Yama, the suffering of the hells, the suffering of the cold hells, and the suffering of the hot hells?”

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Subāhu, moreover, the bodhisattva should train correctly in the following way:🔽‘I will remove the suffering of that infinite and limitless multitude of sentient beings, even if it is connected with each instant of mind for just one instant of mind.

original: gang zhig sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de'i sdug bsngal sems kyi skad cig gcig pa'i sems kyi skad cig gcig tsam dang 'brel ba bsal bar 'dod pa de yang sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas🔽shing mtha' yas pa 'phel la /
analyzed: gang zhig sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de'i sdug bsngal sems kyi skad cig gcig pa'i sems kyi skad cig gcig tsam dang 'brel ba bsal bar 'dod pa de yang sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa 'phel la /
translated: In that way, the roots of virtue will increase for me in each instant of mind,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa rgyas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa rgyas par 'gyur na /
translated: and the infinite and limitless roots of virtue will flourish.’

original: gang zhig ma 'ongs shing ma byin pa'i bskal pa mtha' yas dpag tu med pa rnams su sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de'i skye ba'i sdug bsngal nas srid pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bar du @295b bsal bar 'dod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos
analyzed: gang zhig ma 'ongs shing ma byin pa'i bskal pa mtha' yas dpag tu med pa rnams su sems can gyi tshogs mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa de'i skye ba'i sdug bsngal nas srid pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bar du @295b bsal bar 'dod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos
translated: What need is there to mention someone who wishes to remove the suffering of birth and the suffering of existence of the infinite, limitless multitudes of sentient beings in the infinite, limitless future?”

original: snyam mo // lag bzang /
analyzed: snyam mo // lag bzang /
translated: “Subāhu,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: a bodhisattva should train in the following way:

original: gang zhig rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan nam /
analyzed: gang zhig rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan nam /
translated: “If someone who wishes for the qualities of a pratyekabuddha

original: nyan thos kyi yon tan 'dod pa de yang sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa 'phel la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi yon tan 'dod pa de yang sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa 'phel la /
translated: or the qualities of a śrāvaka will increase infinite, limitless roots of virtue in every moment of thought

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa rgyas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa rgyas par 'gyur na /
translated: and will expand infinite, limitless roots of virtue,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang sangs rgyas kyi chos yon tan mtha' yas shing yon tan mu med pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang sangs rgyas kyi chos yon tan mtha' yas shing yon tan mu med pa /
translated: then, Subāhu, what need is there to mention a son of family or daughter of family who wishes for the infinite, limitless qualities of a buddha,

original: stobs mtha' yas shing stobs mu med pa mtha' dag chub pa yongs su rdzogs pa 'dod pa dang / smos pa dang / smon pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: stobs mtha' yas shing stobs mu med pa mtha' dag chub pa yongs su rdzogs pa 'dod pa dang / smos pa dang / smon pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention the desire, the aspiration, the wish to attain the infinite, limitless, complete, and perfect powers?

original: bag med par gyur ram /
analyzed: bag med par gyur ram /
translated: What need is there to mention those who wish for, aspire to, and long for the infinite, limitless, and complete perfection of the infinite, limitless, and complete perfection of the powers?🔽Even if they are careless

original: gnyid kyis log kyang /
analyzed: gnyid kyis log kyang /
translated: or asleep,

original: rgyu bzhi dang / rkyen bzhi dang / dmigs pa bzhi po de dag ni de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phung po mtha' yas shing mu med pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phung po mtha' yas shing mu med pa bzhi sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu bzhi dang / rkyen bzhi dang / dmigs pa bzhi po de dag ni de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phung po mtha' yas shing mu med pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phung po mtha' yas shing mu med pa bzhi sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: these four causes, four conditions, and four focal points will cause the four infinite, limitless, and complete perfections of their roots of virtue to increase and expand in every moment of mind, and the four infinite, limitless, and complete perfections of the accumulations for awakening to increase and expand in every moment of mind.

original: sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa bzhi skyes pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa bzhi skye ba dag gis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed par mi dka' na /🔽bdag gis 'dir sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' @296a *//
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa bzhi skyes pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa bzhi skye ba dag gis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed par mi dka' na / bdag gis 'dir sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' @296a *//
translated: In each moment of mind, four limitless and infinite heaps of wholesome actions arise, and four limitless and infinite heaps of the accumulations for complete awakening arise. It is not difficult to attain complete awakening with these.

original: yas pa bzhi dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa bzhi yang dag par rjes su mthong la /
analyzed: yas pa bzhi dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs kyi phung po mtha' yas shing mtha' yas pa bzhi yang dag par rjes su mthong la /
translated: Here, in each moment of mind, I see four limitless and infinite heaps of wholesome actions and four limitless and infinite heaps of the accumulations for complete awakening.

original: gzhi de las rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed par mi dka' bar yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus srog gi phyir yang ci'i phyir nyams par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: gzhi de las rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed par mi dka' bar yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus srog gi phyir yang ci'i phyir nyams par bya snyam mo //
translated: “How could I possibly let my diligence decline, even at the cost of my life, when I see that it is not difficult to attain perfect awakening on the basis of this?”

original: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi ni shar phyogs kyi mtha' yang mngon zhing mu yang mngon la /🔽lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi mtha' yang mngon zhing /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi ni shar phyogs kyi mtha' yang mngon zhing mu yang mngon la / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi mtha' yang mngon zhing /
translated: The four great oceans have a visible end and a visible limit.

original: mu yang mngon la /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya mtsho mtha' yas mu med pa bzhi po de dag la ni mtha' dang mu yod pa ma yin na bdag gis sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi tshogs kyi rgya mtsho chen po bzhi po
analyzed: mu yang mngon la / dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya mtsho mtha' yas mu med pa bzhi po de dag la ni mtha' dang mu yod pa ma yin na bdag gis sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi tshogs kyi rgya mtsho chen po bzhi po
translated: The southern, western, and northern oceans, as well as the lower and upper oceans, have a visible end and a visible limit.🔽But these four oceans of roots of virtue, which are infinite and limitless, have no end and no limit.

original: 'di dag 'phel zhing rgyas na /
analyzed: 'di dag 'phel zhing rgyas na /
translated: In each moment of mind, I increase and expand these four great oceans of roots of virtue, which are the accumulations of virtue that lead to awakening.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba la srog gi phyir yang ci'i phyir brtson 'grus nyams par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba la srog gi phyir yang ci'i phyir brtson 'grus nyams par bya snyam mo //
translated: For the sake of my life, why should I give up the effort that will lead to the attainment of perfect awakening?”

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subāhu, a bodhisattva should train correctly as follows:

original: gang dag seng ge dang / stag dang / khyi dang / ce sbyang dang / bya rgod dang / khrung khrung dang / bya rog dang / 'ug pa dang / srin bu dang / sbrang ma dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang du gyur pa de dag gis kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur na /
analyzed: gang dag seng ge dang / stag dang / khyi dang / ce sbyang dang / bya rgod dang / khrung khrung dang / bya rog dang / 'ug pa dang / srin bu dang / sbrang ma dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang du gyur pa de dag gis kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur na /
translated: ‘Even those who have been born as lions, tigers, dogs, jackals, vultures, cranes, crows, owls, worms, bees, flies, and mosquitoes have attained perfect awakening.

original: bdag mir gyur bzhin du srog gi phyir yang @296b ci'i phyir rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur pa'i brtson 'grus nyams par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag mir gyur bzhin du srog gi phyir yang @296b ci'i phyir rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur pa'i brtson 'grus nyams par bya snyam mo //
translated: So why, as a human being, should I give up the effort that will lead to the attainment of perfect awakening, even for the sake of my life?’

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subāhu, a bodhisattva should train correctly as follows:

original: mi brgya'am / mi stong gis kyang sangs rgyas nyid rtogs shing thob na /
analyzed: mi brgya'am / mi stong gis kyang sangs rgyas nyid rtogs shing thob na /
translated: If a hundred or a thousand people can understand and attain buddhahood,

original: bdag gis kyang 'dir ci'i phyir mi rtogs shing thob par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang 'dir ci'i phyir mi rtogs shing thob par mi 'gyur //
translated: why should I not understand and attain it here?

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang rtogs shing brnyes /
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang rtogs shing brnyes /
translated: The tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened buddhas, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, have also understood and attained it.

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang rtogs shing brnyes pa gyur na /
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang rtogs shing brnyes pa gyur na /
translated: The tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened buddhas, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, have understood and attained it,

original: bdag gis 'dir srog gi phyir yang ci'i phyir rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus nyams par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis 'dir srog gi phyir yang ci'i phyir rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus nyams par bya snyam mo //
translated: why should I, for the sake of my life, diminish my diligence that will lead to the attainment of perfect awakening here?

original: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin te /🔽sangs rgyas ston pa'o zhes ston na /
analyzed: lag bzang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin te / sangs rgyas ston pa'o zhes ston na /
translated: “Moreover, Subāhu, a bodhisattva is one who has undertaken diligence.🔽If it is taught that the Buddha is the teacher,

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'am /
translated: then it is taught that the Buddha is the one who speaks.

original: nyan thos kyis bshad pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis bshad pa'am /
translated: the teachings of the śrāvakas,

original: byang chub sems dpas bshad pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bshad pa'am /
translated: the teachings of the bodhisattvas,🔽or even the teachings of the insane,

original: tha na smyon pa rnams kyis bshad pa'i chos gang yin pa dag dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: tha na smyon pa rnams kyis bshad pa'i chos gang yin pa dag dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi @297a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi @297a *//
translated: the attainment of the qualities of a buddha,🔽the attainment of complete awakening,🔽and the attainment of omniscience.

original: chos thob par 'gyur ba dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du rtag par rgyun du nyan no //
analyzed: chos thob par 'gyur ba dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du rtag par rgyun du nyan no //
translated: He listens to those teachings constantly and always, as if his head or clothes were on fire.

original: nges par byed do //
analyzed: nges par byed do //
translated: He is certain about them.

original: rtog go / mkhas pa le lo med pa ni ru shing bzhin byed cing /
analyzed: rtog go / mkhas pa le lo med pa ni ru shing bzhin byed cing /
translated: The wise one, who is not lazy, acts like a winnowing fan.

original: yid la byed pas mdung thung dag gis bzlog kyang de mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du rtag par rgyun du chos de dag 'dzin to //
analyzed: yid la byed pas mdung thung dag gis bzlog kyang de mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du rtag par rgyun du chos de dag 'dzin to //
translated: Even though he is blocked by the spears of mental activity, he always and continuously holds those dharmas as if his head and clothes were on fire.

original: yongs su shes par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su shes par byed do //
translated: He fully understands them.

original: 'chang ngo // klog go /
analyzed: 'chang ngo // klog go /
translated: He upholds them. He reads them.

original: rjes su sems so //
analyzed: rjes su sems so //
translated: He thinks about them.

original: gzhan dag la ston no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ston no //
translated: He teaches them to others.

original: go bar byed do //
analyzed: go bar byed do //
translated: He makes them understood.

original: mkhas pa le lo med pa ni ru shing bzhin du byed cing yid la byed pas mdung thung dag gis bzlog kyang rlung de bcol kyang rung /
analyzed: mkhas pa le lo med pa ni ru shing bzhin du byed cing yid la byed pas mdung thung dag gis bzlog kyang rlung de bcol kyang rung /
translated: The wise one, who is not lazy, acts like a winnowing fan. Even though he is blocked by the spears of mental activity, he always and continuously holds those dharmas as if his head and clothes were on fire.

original: ma bcol kyang rung /🔽sems can thams cad kyi don dang ci bya ba chos dang ldan pa 'jig rten 'di la bde ba'am /
analyzed: ma bcol kyang rung / sems can thams cad kyi don dang ci bya ba chos dang ldan pa 'jig rten 'di la bde ba'am /
translated: Whether he is asked or not,🔽he makes himself available to all sentient beings as a means for accomplishing what is to be done that is in accord with the Dharma, for the happiness of this world,

original: 'jig rten pha rol tu bde ba dag la rang gi lus nye bar spyod pa dang yo byad du 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol tu bde ba dag la rang gi lus nye bar spyod pa dang yo byad du 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: and for the happiness of the next world.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na; 'byung ba chen po sgrib pa med pa yongs su gzung ba med pa bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can thams cad la nye bar spyod pa dang yo byad du 'gyur ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: dper na; 'byung ba chen po sgrib pa med pa yongs su gzung ba med pa bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can thams cad la nye bar spyod pa dang yo byad du 'gyur ba rnams yin no //
translated: For example, these four great elements, which are unobstructed and ungraspable, are the resources and enjoyments of all sentient beings.

original: lag bzang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang rang gi lus sems can thams cad kyi nye bar spyod pa dang yo byad du gyur par byed de /🔽sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / byang chub @297b sems dpa' dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / rgan pa dang / nad pa dang / mgon med pa rnams la yongs su spyad par bya ba dang / sri zhu bya ba dang /
analyzed: lag bzang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang rang gi lus sems can thams cad kyi nye bar spyod pa dang yo byad du gyur par byed de / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / byang chub @297b sems dpa' dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / rgan pa dang / nad pa dang / mgon med pa rnams la yongs su spyad par bya ba dang / sri zhu bya ba dang /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the bodhisattva makes his own body the resources and enjoyments of all sentient beings.

original: bsnyen bkur bya bas bye brag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya bas bye brag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: He is distinguished by his service, attendance, and veneration of the Buddha, the Dharma, the Saṅgha, the bodhisattvas, the masters, the gurus, the elders, the sick, and the unprotected.

original: de mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du gzhan gyi sems dang / gzhan gyi snying dga' bar 'gyur ba'i tshig dang rjes su mthun pa dang / mthun par byed pa dang / yang dag par byed pa dang / grogs byed pa dang / grogs su gyur pa dang /🔽dge ba mthun pa dang / don mthun pas rjes su zhugs nas mngon du dad par byas shing bsdus te /🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa la 'os pa rnams ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la 'dzud do //🔽'dul lo // 'god do //
