original: mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin dam pa'i chos kyi rgyu dang / dam pa'i chos kyi ched dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rgyu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi ched dang / dge ba'i rgyu dang / dge ba'i ched la grang ba yang khyad du gsod la /
analyzed: mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin dam pa'i chos kyi rgyu dang / dam pa'i chos kyi ched dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rgyu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi ched dang / dge ba'i rgyu dang / dge ba'i ched la grang ba yang khyad du gsod la /
translated: Like someone whose head or clothes are on fire, they disregard cold for the sake of the holy Dharma, for the sake of the holy Dharma, for the sake of the six perfections, for the sake of the six perfections, for the sake of virtue, and for the sake of virtue.

original: tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyis reg pa dang / gzhan gyis ngan du smras pa dang / ngan du brjod pa'i @298a *//
analyzed: tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyis reg pa dang / gzhan gyis ngan du smras pa dang / ngan du brjod pa'i @298a *//
translated: They disregard heat, hunger, thirst, contact with gadflies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and snakes, and the ill-spoken, abusive words of others.

original: tshig gi lam dang / ngal ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / gnyid dang / mi dga' ba dang / lus dang srog kyang khyad du gsod do //
analyzed: tshig gi lam dang / ngal ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / gnyid dang / mi dga' ba dang / lus dang srog kyang khyad du gsod do //
translated: They disregard fatigue, afflictions, sleep, unhappiness, and even their own bodies and lives.

original: mkhas pa le lo med pa ni mdud thung dag gis bzlog kyang de rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ched la lha'i sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //
analyzed: mkhas pa le lo med pa ni mdud thung dag gis bzlog kyang de rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ched la lha'i sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //
translated: He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the gods.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of men.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the demi-gods.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the ghosts.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of animals.🔽The wise person who is not lazy, even if turned back by a hundred obstacles, will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of his life.

original: lha ma yin gyi sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //
translated: He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the gods.

original: mi'i sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //🔽yi dvags kyi sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //
analyzed: mi'i sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do // yi dvags kyi sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //
translated: He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of men.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the demi-gods.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the ghosts.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of animals.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal dang / sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang khyad du gsod do //
translated: He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the denizens of hell.

original: mkhas pa le lo med pa ni mdud thung dag gis bzlog kyang de mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba dang / spyod lam dang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtan zhing rtul ba brtan no //
analyzed: mkhas pa le lo med pa ni mdud thung dag gis bzlog kyang de mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bskang ba thob par bya ba dang / spyod lam dang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtan zhing rtul ba brtan no //
translated: The wise person who is not lazy, even if turned back by a hundred obstacles, will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of his life.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the gods.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of men.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the demi-gods.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the ghosts.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of animals.🔽He will not give up the practice of perfect enlightenment, even at the cost of the happiness of the denizens

original: de brtson 'grus 'di dang / rtul ba 'di mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa dang / brtsam par 'dod pa na yang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
analyzed: de brtson 'grus 'di dang / rtul ba 'di mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa dang / brtsam par 'dod pa na yang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
translated: When they wish to manifest this kind of effort and this kind of striving, and when they wish to begin, they dedicate so that all sentient beings may be liberated, so that all sentient beings may be freed, so that all sentient beings may be comforted,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: so that they may attain omniscience, and so that they may complete all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: mngon sum du byed pa dang / rtsom pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa @298b dang; brtsams nas kyang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa dang / rtsom pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa @298b dang; brtsams nas kyang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang /
translated: When they manifest it, when they begin, when they manifest it and begin, they dedicate so that all sentient beings may be liberated, so that all sentient beings may be freed, so that all sentient beings may be comforted,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: so that they may attain omniscience, and so that they may complete all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: gal te brtson 'grus 'di ma nyams pa dang / skyon med pa dang / 'dren ma ma yin par slob pa'i nus pa dang mi ldan par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te brtson 'grus 'di ma nyams pa dang / skyon med pa dang / 'dren ma ma yin par slob pa'i nus pa dang mi ldan par gyur na /
translated: If he is not able to train in this kind of effort without decline, without fault, and without mixture,

original: de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste dus su'am /
analyzed: de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste dus su'am /
translated: he should train correctly in this way: at the appropriate time,

original: cung zad cung zad du yang snyoms las dang / le lo spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar rtsol lo //
analyzed: cung zad cung zad du yang snyoms las dang / le lo spang ba dang / dor ba dang / bsal bar rtsol lo //
translated: he should strive to abandon, remove, and clear away laziness and idleness, even if it is only a little bit.

original: 'bad do // dus dus su'am /
analyzed: 'bad do // dus dus su'am /
translated: He should make an effort.🔽At the appropriate time, he should strive to train in, increase, and perfect effort and vigor, even if it is only a little bit.

original: cung zad cung zad du yang brtson 'grus dang rtul ba la slob pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar bya ba dang yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rtsol lo //
analyzed: cung zad cung zad du yang brtson 'grus dang rtul ba la slob pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar bya ba dang yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rtsol lo //
translated: He should make an effort.

original: 'bad do // srid pa gzhan du gyur pa na yang zhum par mi 'gyur zhing sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bad do // srid pa gzhan du gyur pa na yang zhum par mi 'gyur zhing sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he changes to another existence, he will not be discouraged or disheartened.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi brtson 'grus dge ba dang /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi brtson 'grus dge ba dang /
translated: Subāhu, the bodhisattvas’ arousing of the mind of awakening, their recollection of the mind of awakening, their cultivation of the mind of awakening, their aspiration for awakening, and their prayers of aspiration for awakening are themselves their countless and immeasurable virtuous efforts

original: rtsol ba dge ba ba grangs med cing dpag tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba dge ba ba grangs med cing dpag tu med pa yin no //
translated: and virtuous strivings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:🔽They wish to arouse in all sentient beings in all world systems the uncontaminated effort

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la zag pa med pa'i brtson 'grus bskyed par 'dod pa dang / @299a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad la zag pa med pa'i brtson 'grus bskyed par 'dod pa dang / @299a *//
translated: and

original: zag pa med pa'i brtson 'grus yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i brtson 'grus bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i brtson 'grus yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa de ni brtson 'grus dge ba dang / rtsol ba dge ba thams cad kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i brtson 'grus yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i brtson 'grus bskyed par 'dod pa dang / mi slob pa'i brtson 'grus yang dag par bskyed par 'dod pa de ni brtson 'grus dge ba dang / rtsol ba dge ba thams cad kyi mchog yin no //
translated: He who wishes to generate uncontaminated effort, he who wishes to generate the effort of one beyond training, he who wishes to generate the effort of one beyond training—that is the best of all virtuous efforts, the best of all virtuous strivings.

original: de ni dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dam pa yin no //
translated: That is the highest.

original: lag bzang / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bde ba dang ldan la /
analyzed: lag bzang / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' bde ba dang ldan la /
translated: Subāhu, in this way the bodhisattva is happy,

original: yid bde ba dang ldan zhing tshegs chung du dang / sdug bsngal chung dus myur du skyen par brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do ////🔽bam po gnyis pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang ldan zhing tshegs chung du dang / sdug bsngal chung dus myur du skyen par brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //// bam po gnyis pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: and with little difficulty and little suffering, he quickly and swiftly completes the perfection of effort.

original: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: lag bzang / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
translated: Subāhu, how does the bodhisattva complete the perfection of concentration?

original: lag bzang / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: lag bzang / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Subāhu, here a bodhisattva, when seeing forms with the eye, does not grasp at signs and does not grasp at secondary characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir mig gi dbang po sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas pas 'jig rten na brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems rjes su zag pa de dag bsdam pa'i phyir nan tan byed cing bsrung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gi dbang po sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas pas 'jig rten na brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems rjes su zag pa de dag bsdam pa'i phyir nan tan byed cing bsrung ste /
translated: Because of not being restrained by the restraint of the eye faculty, in the world he would pursue covetousness, mental unhappiness, and sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas. In order to restrain those, he practices and guards them.

original: mig gi dbang pos mig gi dbang po sdom par byed do //
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos mig gi dbang po sdom par byed do //
translated: He restrains the eye faculty with the eye faculty.

original: de bzhin du rna bas sgra rnams thos pa dang / snas dri rnams tshor ba dang / lces ro rnams myong ba dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams reg pa dang / yid kyis @299b chos rnams rnam par shes nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin zhing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna bas sgra rnams thos pa dang / snas dri rnams tshor ba dang / lces ro rnams myong ba dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams reg pa dang / yid kyis @299b chos rnams rnam par shes nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin zhing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, when hearing sounds with the ear, smelling scents with the nose, tasting flavors with the tongue, touching touchables with the body, and cognizing dharmas with the mind, he does not grasp at signs and does not grasp at secondary characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir yid kyi dbang po sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas pas 'jig rten na brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems rjes su zag pa de dag bsdam pa'i phyir nan tan byed cing bsrung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid kyi dbang po sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas pas 'jig rten na brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems rjes su zag pa de dag bsdam pa'i phyir nan tan byed cing bsrung ste /
translated: “Because he is not restrained by the restraint of the faculty of the mind, he is in the world covetous, has a mind of ill will, and his mind is polluted by bad, unwholesome states.

original: yid kyi dbang pos yid kyi dbang po sdom pa byed do; ;de 'gro'am /🔽'greng ngam / 'dug gam /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang pos yid kyi dbang po sdom pa byed do; ;de 'gro'am / 'greng ngam / 'dug gam /
translated: He is diligent and guards the faculty of the mind, he achieves restraint of the faculty of the mind.🔽Whether he is walking, standing, sitting, or lying down,

original: nyal lam / cang mi smra bar gyur kyang rung ste /
analyzed: nyal lam / cang mi smra bar gyur kyang rung ste /
translated: whether he is speaking or silent,

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas dang / zhi ba'i gnas kyi gnas mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas dang / zhi ba'i gnas kyi gnas mi 'dor ro //
translated: he does not abandon the state of concentration, the state of peace.

original: rnam par mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'dor ro //
translated: He does not abandon it.

original: de lag mi rgod pa dang / mu cor mi smra ba dang / tshig mi mang ba dang / mig mi g-yeng ba dang / dbang po mi g-yeng ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / tom col med pa dang / lus 'khrul pa med pa dang; ngag 'khrul ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de lag mi rgod pa dang / mu cor mi smra ba dang / tshig mi mang ba dang / mig mi g-yeng ba dang / dbang po mi g-yeng ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / tom col med pa dang / lus 'khrul pa med pa dang; ngag 'khrul ba med pa dang /
translated: He is not restless with his hands, does not prattle, does not speak much, does not move his eyes, does not move his faculties, is not restless, is not fickle, does not err with his body, does not err with his speech,

original: sems 'khrul pa med pa dang / dben yang rung /
analyzed: sems 'khrul pa med pa dang / dben yang rung /
translated: Their minds are free from delusion,

original: mi dben yang rung /
analyzed: mi dben yang rung /
translated: whether they are in solitude or not.

original: spyod lam mi nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod lam mi nyams pa yin no //
translated: They do not let their conduct deteriorate.

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / gnas dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ji lta bu yang rung ba dag gis chog shes shing gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / rim gro bya sla ba dang /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / gnas dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ji lta bu yang rung ba dag gis chog shes shing gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / rim gro bya sla ba dang /
translated: They are content with whatever food and drink, bedding and seats, and medicines for sickness they receive, and they are easy to care for, easy to satisfy, and easy to please.

original: cho ga dang spyod yul dge ba dang / 'du 'dzi las dben pa'i spyod yul yin /
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul dge ba dang / 'du 'dzi las dben pa'i spyod yul yin /
translated: They have a pure conduct and lifestyle, and they live in solitude.

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa la mnyam zhing 'gyur pa med do //
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa la mnyam zhing 'gyur pa med do //
translated: They are the same toward those who have attained and those who have not attained, and they are free from change.

original: ma khengs ma dud pa yin /
analyzed: ma khengs ma dud pa yin /
translated: They are not arrogant or obsequious.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stod pa dang smod pa @300a *//
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stod pa dang smod pa @300a *//
translated: They are the same toward those who are happy and those who are suffering, those who are praised and those who are disparaged,

original: dang; grags pa dang ma grags pa dang / 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba la mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: dang; grags pa dang ma grags pa dang / 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba la mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med de /
translated: those who are famous and those who are unknown, and those who are alive and those who are dead, and they are free from change.

original: ma khengs mi 'dud pa yin /
analyzed: ma khengs mi 'dud pa yin /
translated: They are not arrogant or obsequious.

original: mdza' bo dang dgra dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang mthun pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang mi mthun pa dang / 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams dang / dben pa dang lang long rnams la mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: mdza' bo dang dgra dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang mthun pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang mi mthun pa dang / 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams dang / dben pa dang lang long rnams la mnyam zhing 'gyur ba med de /
translated: He is the same toward friends and enemies, toward the wholesome and the unwholesome, toward what is agreeable and disagreeable, toward the noble and the ignoble, and toward the crowded and the secluded.

original: ma khengs mdud pa yin /
analyzed: ma khengs mdud pa yin /
translated: He is not puffed up by praise, nor is he sullen at criticism.

original: gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnams la yang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa med pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnams la yang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa med pa yin /
translated: He is the same toward beautiful and ugly forms, and he is not attracted or averse to them.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa rnams la yang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa rnams la yang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa med pa yin no //
translated: He is the same toward agreeable and disagreeable sounds, smells, tastes, and touchables, and he is not attracted or averse to them.

original: de 'dod pa rnams ni rang gi sems kyis kun du bslang nas log par rnam par rtog pas ro myang ba yin pas keng rus lta bur yid la byed do //
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams ni rang gi sems kyis kun du bslang nas log par rnam par rtog pas ro myang ba yin pas keng rus lta bur yid la byed do //
translated: He considers sensual pleasures to be like skeletons, because they are aroused by one’s own thoughts and are relished by false imagination.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni dgra mang ba'i phyir sha sna gu lta bur yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni dgra mang ba'i phyir sha sna gu lta bur yid la byed do //
translated: He considers sensual pleasures to be like a skeleton, because they are the cause of much hostility.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni blangs na sdug bsngal la yongs su btang na bde ba'i phyir rtsva me lta bur yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni blangs na sdug bsngal la yongs su btang na bde ba'i phyir rtsva me lta bur yid la byed do //
translated: One should consider sense objects as grass, because taking them up leads to suffering, and giving them up leads to happiness.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni gnod pa mang ba'i phyi shing gi rtse mo'i shing tog lta bur yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni gnod pa mang ba'i phyi shing gi rtse mo'i shing tog lta bur yid la byed do //
translated: One should consider sense objects as fruit at the top of a tree, because they are full of danger.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni dbang byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir slong ba lta bur yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni dbang byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir slong ba lta bur yid la byed do //
translated: One should consider sense objects as beggars, because they are not in one’s power.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni skad cig tsam zhig nor bas dga' ba'i phyir rmi lam lta bur yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni skad cig tsam zhig nor bas dga' ba'i phyir rmi lam lta bur yid la byed do //
translated: One should consider sense objects as a dream, because one is delighted by them for a moment and then loses them.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni @300b sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa phyin ci log gis bskyed pa'i phyir mdze lta bu yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni @300b sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa phyin ci log gis bskyed pa'i phyir mdze lta bu yid la byed do //
translated: One should consider sense objects as leprosy, because they are produced by the error of taking suffering for happiness.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni shes par spyod pa thams cad kyi dngos po yin pa dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i mtha' yin pas mchil pa lta bu yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni shes par spyod pa thams cad kyi dngos po yin pa dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i mtha' yin pas mchil pa lta bu yid la byed do //
translated: One should consider sense objects as spittle, because they are the cause of all the troubles of life, because they lead to the lower realms, and because they lead to the hells.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni ngoms par mi byed pa dang / skom pa 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir tshva chu lta bur yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni ngoms par mi byed pa dang / skom pa 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir tshva chu lta bur yid la byed do //
translated: He should contemplate desires as being like salt water, because they do not satisfy and increase thirst.

original: de 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
analyzed: de 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: “He should be secluded from desires,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /🔽dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa / dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: secluded from evil, unwholesome states,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so // de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: and he should enter and remain in the first absorption, which is accompanied by thought and investigation, and filled with rapture and joy, born of seclusion.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /🔽dpyod pa med pa /🔽ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa / dpyod pa med pa / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: “With the subsiding of thought and investigation, he enters and remains in the second absorption, which has internal confidence and unification of mind, is without thought and investigation, and is filled with rapture and joy, born of concentration.🔽“With the fading away of rapture, he remains equanimous, mindful, and clearly knowing, and experiences pleasure with the body; he enters and remains in the third absorption of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who dwells happily.’

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas zhing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas zhing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: “With the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the earlier disappearance of joy and dejection, he enters and remains in the fourth absorption, which is neither painful nor pleasant and includes the purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The noble ones call it the equanimity of one who is mindful and who abides in happiness.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de bde ba yang spangs te snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so // de bde ba yang spangs te snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: He accomplishes and abides in the third concentration.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma @301a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma @301a *//
translated: He abandons pleasure, abandons pain, and having previously abandoned mental pleasure and displeasure, he abides in equanimity and mindfulness.

original: yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de sems can thams cad la bde ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas byams pa tshad med pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so // de sems can thams cad la bde ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas byams pa tshad med pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He accomplishes and abides in the fourth concentration.🔽He accomplishes and abides in immeasurable love, bringing to mind the thought of happiness for all sentient beings.

original: de sems can thams cad la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas snying rje tshad med pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de sems can thams cad la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas snying rje tshad med pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He accomplishes and abides in immeasurable compassion, bringing to mind the thought of the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: de sems can rnams la dga' ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dga' ba tshad med pa bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de sems can rnams la sdug bsngal yang med /
analyzed: de sems can rnams la dga' ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dga' ba tshad med pa bsgrubs te gnas so // de sems can rnams la sdug bsngal yang med /
translated: He dwells having achieved immeasurable love for sentient beings by bringing to mind the perception of joy toward sentient beings.

original: bde ba yang med pa yid la byed pas btang snyoms tshad med pa bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de gzugs la rags pa'i 'du shes yid la byed cing /
analyzed: bde ba yang med pa yid la byed pas btang snyoms tshad med pa bsgrubs te gnas so // de gzugs la rags pa'i 'du shes yid la byed cing /
translated: He dwells having achieved immeasurable equanimity for sentient beings by bringing to mind the absence of suffering and the absence of joy toward sentient beings.

original: nam mkha' la zhi ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la zhi ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having achieved the sphere of infinite space by bringing to mind the perception of grossness toward form and the perception of peace toward space.

original: de rnam par shes pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having achieved the sphere of infinite consciousness by bringing to mind the perception of peace toward consciousness.

original: de ci yang med pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de ci yang med pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having achieved the sphere of nothingness by bringing to mind the perception of peace toward nothingness.

original: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min la zhi ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min la zhi ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having accomplished and having based himself on the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, by bringing to mind the perception of peace in the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: de rang gi dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba ji ltar gnas shing ji ltar 'dug pa de bzhin du rgyun thung ba rnams la yang rgyun @301b thung ba'i 'du shes dang / rgyun ring ba rnams la yang rgyun ring ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de rang gi dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba ji ltar gnas shing ji ltar 'dug pa de bzhin du rgyun thung ba rnams la yang rgyun @301b thung ba'i 'du shes dang / rgyun ring ba rnams la yang rgyun ring ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having accomplished and having based himself on mindfulness while breathing in and breathing out, by bringing to mind the shortness of the breath and the length of the breath, as it is, as it is.

original: de sems can gyi lus rnams la mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de sems can gyi lus rnams la mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having accomplished and having based himself on the perception of foulness, by bringing to mind the signs of foulness in the bodies of sentient beings.

original: de 'chi ba'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas 'chi ba'i 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas 'chi ba'i 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having accomplished and having based himself on the perception of death, by bringing to mind the signs of death.

original: de na ba dang / rga ba'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de na ba dang / rga ba'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: There, by bringing to mind the characteristics of sickness and old age, he accomplishes the perception of danger and abides by it.

original: de kha zas yongs su tshol ba dang 'gyur ba la nad kyi rgyu dang gnod pa'i rgyur yid la byed pas kha zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de kha zas yongs su tshol ba dang 'gyur ba la nad kyi rgyu dang gnod pa'i rgyur yid la byed pas kha zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: There, by bringing to mind the causes of sickness and harm in the transformation of the search for food, he accomplishes the perception of unattractiveness in food and abides by it.

original: de khyim dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs kyi 'jig rten thams cad la 'byor ba dang 'brel ba'i mtshan mar yid la byed pa dang / nags tshal rmad du byung ba dang / kun dga' ra ba rmad du byung ba dang bral ba'i mtshan mar yid la byed pas 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de khyim dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs kyi 'jig rten thams cad la 'byor ba dang 'brel ba'i mtshan mar yid la byed pa dang / nags tshal rmad du byung ba dang / kun dga' ra ba rmad du byung ba dang bral ba'i mtshan mar yid la byed pas 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: There, by bringing to mind the characteristics of the world of the household, the village, the town, and the country as a cause of wealth and by bringing to mind the characteristics of the world of the forest as a cause of freedom from the marvelous and the delightful, he accomplishes the perception of non-delight in the whole world and abides by it.

original: de nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol kyi gzugs chung du kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol kyi gzugs chung du kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are small, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the first station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the second station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the third station of overcoming.

original: de nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs gzhan med pa kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye @302a *//🔽mched gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs gzhan med pa kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye @302a *// mched gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the fourth station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the fifth station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the sixth station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the seventh station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the eighth station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the ninth station of overcoming.

original: de shi ba'i lus bsregs pa de la rlung ngam chus thal ba yang med par byed pa'i 'du shes dang / zhigs pa la phye ma yang med pa dang / rdul du gyur pa la rdul kyang med pa'i 'du shes su rnam par 'jig pa bsgoms shing bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de shi ba'i lus bsregs pa de la rlung ngam chus thal ba yang med par byed pa'i 'du shes dang / zhigs pa la phye ma yang med pa dang / rdul du gyur pa la rdul kyang med pa'i 'du shes su rnam par 'jig pa bsgoms shing bsgrubs te /
translated: Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the tenth station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the eleventh station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the twelfth station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other, beautiful, and ugly, and they accomplish and abide in the thirteenth station of overcoming.🔽Having the perception of form internally, they focus their minds on the external forms that are not other

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung du kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de de bzhin du nang gzugs med bar 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs tshad med pa kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung du kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so // de de bzhin du nang gzugs med bar 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs tshad med pa kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: With the perception of no inner form, he achieves and remains in the third station of overcoming, in which he attends to the forms of others that are small and beautiful or ugly as signs.🔽In the same way, with the perception of no inner form, he achieves and remains in the fourth station of overcoming, in which he attends to the forms of others that are immeasurable and beautiful or ugly as signs.

original: da de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po tshad med pa yid du 'ong ba rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: da de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po tshad med pa yid du 'ong ba rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: In the same way, with the perception of no inner form, he achieves and remains in the fifth station of overcoming, in which he attends to the forms of others that are blue, immeasurable, and beautiful as signs.

original: de de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po tshad med pa yid du 'ong ba rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched drug pa dang /
analyzed: de de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po tshad med pa yid du 'ong ba rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched drug pa dang /
translated: In the same way, with the perception of no inner form, they focus on the limitless outer forms that are yellow, red, white, and beautiful, and they accomplish and abide in the sixth base of overpowering.

original: bdun pa dang / brgyad pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bdun pa dang / brgyad pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: They accomplish and abide in the seventh and eighth bases of overpowering.

original: des 'di mtha' yas so zhes mtshan mar @302b yid la byed pas zad par sar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: des 'di mtha' yas so zhes mtshan mar @302b yid la byed pas zad par sar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: They accomplish and abide in the base of infinite space by focusing on the idea that space is infinite.

original: de chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so zhes mtshan mar yid la byed pas zad par chu dang /
analyzed: de chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so zhes mtshan mar yid la byed pas zad par chu dang /
translated: They accomplish and abide in the bases of infinite consciousness, nothingness, and neither existence nor nonexistence by focusing on the ideas that consciousness, nothingness, and neither existence nor nonexistence are infinite.

original: zad par me dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' dang / zad par rnam par shes pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: zad par me dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' dang / zad par rnam par shes pa bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He accomplishes and abides in the meditative absorption of the fire-element, the meditative absorption of the wind-element, the meditative absorption of the blue-element, the meditative absorption of the yellow-element, the meditative absorption of the red-element, the meditative absorption of the white-element, the meditative absorption of the space-element, and the meditative absorption of the consciousness-element.

original: de snyoms par 'jug pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'dogs te /
analyzed: de snyoms par 'jug pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'dogs te /
translated: “When he enters into meditative absorption, he focuses his mind on all the roots of virtue.

original: snying rje chen po la dmigs pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba la dmigs pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi 'chad par bya ba la dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / rgyan la dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung tshangs pa'i dbyangs la dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la dmigs pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba la dmigs pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi 'chad par bya ba la dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / rgyan la dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung tshangs pa'i dbyangs la dmigs pa dang /
translated: He focuses on great compassion, on upholding the sublime Dharma, on ensuring that the lineage of the Three Jewels is never interrupted, on the body and ornaments of the Buddha, on the Buddha’s speech, which is the melodious voice of Brahmā,

original: sngon gyi smon lam la dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la dmigs pa dang / 'jig rten rnam par sbyang ba la dmigs pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po'i bkod pa la dmigs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam la dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la dmigs pa dang / 'jig rten rnam par sbyang ba la dmigs pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po'i bkod pa la dmigs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la dmigs pa dang /
translated: They focus on their past aspirations, on bringing all sentient beings to full maturity, on purifying the world, on the array of the seat of awakening, on turning the wheel of Dharma,

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa gzhom pa la dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa gzhom pa la dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: and on overcoming the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: de bsam gtan byed pa na rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi dang bral bar bsam gtan byed do //
analyzed: de bsam gtan byed pa na rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi dang bral bar bsam gtan byed do //
translated: When they practice concentration, they do so free from the four bases of consciousness.

original: sa'i khams la mi gnas @303a *//
analyzed: sa'i khams la mi gnas @303a *//
translated: They do not dwell on the earth element,

original: chu'i khams la mi gnas /
analyzed: chu'i khams la mi gnas /
translated: the water element,

original: me'i khams la mi gnas /🔽rlung gi khams la mi gnas /
analyzed: me'i khams la mi gnas / rlung gi khams la mi gnas /
translated: the fire element,🔽the wind element,

original: nam mkha'i khams la mi gnas /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la mi gnas /
translated: the space element,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams la mi gnas /🔽'jig rten 'di la mi gnas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams la mi gnas / 'jig rten 'di la mi gnas /
translated: or the consciousness element.🔽They do not dwell on this world

original: 'jig rten pha rol la mi gnas par bsam gtan byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la mi gnas par bsam gtan byed do //
translated: or on the next world.

original: de ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bla na med pa thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan la gnas shing bsam gtan la dga'o //🔽de bsam gtan de dang / ting nge 'dzin de la bsam gtan byed par 'dod pa dang / snyoms par 'jug par 'dod pa na yang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bla na med pa thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan la gnas shing bsam gtan la dga'o // de bsam gtan de dang / ting nge 'dzin de la bsam gtan byed par 'dod pa dang / snyoms par 'jug par 'dod pa na yang sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sems can thams cad dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung ba dang /
translated: He abides in meditation and delights in meditation in order to attain all the unexcelled concentrations and meditative absorptions.🔽And when he wishes to practice meditation and enter meditative absorption in those concentrations and meditative absorptions, he dedicates them all to the attainment of omniscience and the completion of all the qualities of the Buddha, in order to liberate all sentient beings, to free all sentient beings, to bring relief to all sentient beings,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: and to bring all sentient beings to the unsurpassed, secure state of nirvāṇa.

original: bdag rtag go snyam pa dang / bdag mi rtag go snyam pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la /🔽mi rtag kyang mi rtag go snyam pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag rtag go snyam pa dang / bdag mi rtag go snyam pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la / mi rtag kyang mi rtag go snyam pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: the self is permanent, the self is impermanent, the self is both permanent and impermanent,

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin no snyam pa dang / bdag mtha' yod do snyam pa dang / bdag mtha' yod pa ma yin no snyam pa dang / mtha' yod kyang yod la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin no snyam pa dang / bdag mtha' yod do snyam pa dang / bdag mtha' yod pa ma yin no snyam pa dang / mtha' yod kyang yod la /
translated: the self is neither permanent nor impermanent, the self has an end, the self does not have an end, the self has an end and does not have an end,🔽the self neither has an end nor does not have an end, the self is the same as the body, the self is different from the body, the Tathāgata exists after death, the Tathāgata does not exist after death, the Tathāgata both exists and does not exist after death,

original: mtha' med kyang med do snyam pa dang / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtha' med kyang med do snyam pa dang / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: the Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist after death.”

original: mtha' med pa yang ma yin no snyam pa dang / de bzhin song ba shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'byung yang 'byung la; mi 'byung yang mi 'byung ngo snyam pa dang / de bzhin song ba shi nas 'byung ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtha' med pa yang ma yin no snyam pa dang / de bzhin song ba shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'byung yang 'byung la; mi 'byung yang mi 'byung ngo snyam pa dang / de bzhin song ba shi nas 'byung ba yang ma yin /
translated: that after death the one who has gone thus will come into being, or that he will not come into being, or that he will both come into being and not come into being, or that he will neither come into being nor not come into being;

original: mi 'byung ba yang ma yin no snyam pa dang / srog de lus yin snyam pa dang / srog kyang gzhan /🔽lus kyang gzhan no snyam pa dang / sems can 'di gang nas 'ongs /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba yang ma yin no snyam pa dang / srog de lus yin snyam pa dang / srog kyang gzhan / lus kyang gzhan no snyam pa dang / sems can 'di gang nas 'ongs /
translated: that the life force is the body, or that the life force is one thing and the body another;🔽that this sentient being has come from somewhere, or that after dying he will go somewhere, or that the sentient being will be annihilated and cease to exist after death;

original: de 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du 'gro bar 'gyur snyam pa dang / sems can yod pa las chad de 'jig cing med par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / byed pa de myong ba de yin no snyam pa dang / byed pa yang gzhan /
analyzed: de 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du 'gro bar 'gyur snyam pa dang / sems can yod pa las chad de 'jig cing med par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / byed pa de myong ba de yin no snyam pa dang / byed pa yang gzhan /
translated: that the one who acts is the one who experiences, or that the one who acts is one thing and the one who experiences is another;

original: myong ba yang gzhan no snyam pa dang / bdag yod pas bdag gi yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / bdag gi yod pas bdag yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di na bdag de lta bu'am /🔽bdag gzhan du 'gyur ba zhig gam /🔽de bzhin du 'gyur ba zhig gam /
analyzed: myong ba yang gzhan no snyam pa dang / bdag yod pas bdag gi yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / bdag gi yod pas bdag yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di na bdag de lta bu'am / bdag gzhan du 'gyur ba zhig gam / de bzhin du 'gyur ba zhig gam /
translated: The self is one thing and the experience is another.🔽The self exists because the “mine” exists.🔽The “mine” exists because the self exists.🔽The self is like this or like that.🔽The self changes into something else.🔽The self becomes like this or like that.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba zhig @309a *//🔽gam; 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur ram /🔽de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ram /🔽gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /🔽'dir bdag sngon 'byung ngam /🔽bdag da ltar byung ngam /🔽bdag gzhan du byung ngam snyam du de dag la bdag tu mngon par zhen te /

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / sems kyi gnas dang / mngon par zhen pa dang / nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal ba dang / snyems pa dang / nga rgyal byed pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i len pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / sems kyi gnas dang / mngon par zhen pa dang / nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal ba dang / snyems pa dang / nga rgyal byed pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i len pa dang /
translated: the latent tendency of pride,🔽conceit,🔽the performance of pride,🔽the grasping of the doctrine of self,🔽and all attachment,🔽aversion, confusion, and pride,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal gang yin pa thams cad dang / lus sam /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal gang yin pa thams cad dang / lus sam /
translated: and all physical,

original: ngag gam / sems kyi las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'am /🔽bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: ngag gam / sems kyi las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'am / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: verbal, and mental actions that are meritorious,🔽demeritorious,

original: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'am /🔽'dod par gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'am / 'dod par gtogs pa'am /
translated: or immovable,🔽and all that is related to the desire realm,🔽the form realm,

original: gzugs su gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa'am /
translated: or the formless realm.

original: gzugs med par gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med par gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the noble ones’ truth of the arising of suffering.

original: gang 'dod chags zad pa dang / zhe sdang zad pa dang / gti mug zad pa dang / nga rgyal zad pa dang / bdag tu mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i len pa spangs pa de ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod chags zad pa dang / zhe sdang zad pa dang / gti mug zad pa dang / nga rgyal zad pa dang / bdag tu mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i len pa spangs pa de ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation of suffering is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, which is the exhaustion of desire, the exhaustion of hatred, the exhaustion of delusion, the exhaustion of pride, the abandonment of clinging to a self, the abandonment of the grasping of the self.

original: gang sdug bsngal la yang sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba la yang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la yang 'gog pa dang / lam la yang lam du yid la @309b byed pa dang / 'du byed rnams la nyes dmigs su lta zhing gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal la yang sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba la yang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la yang 'gog pa dang / lam la yang lam du yid la @309b byed pa dang / 'du byed rnams la nyes dmigs su lta zhing gnas pa dang /
translated: The noble truth of the path is the path that leads to the cessation of suffering, which is the mental activity of regarding suffering as suffering, regarding the origin of suffering as the origin of suffering, regarding the cessation of suffering as the cessation of suffering, and regarding the path as the path; the observation of the faults of conditioned phenomena;

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon du lta zhing gnas pa dang / ji ltar mthong ba dang / rgyu byas pa la so sor rtog pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon du lta zhing gnas pa dang / ji ltar mthong ba dang / rgyu byas pa la so sor rtog pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang /
translated: the observation of the benefits of nirvāṇa; the correct view that is the discernment of what has been seen and what has been done; correct intention; correct speech;

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran bdag yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran bdag yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration, and right knowledge are called the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the four noble truths.

original: de 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag la dpyod cing rtog la khong du chud par byed cing //
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag la dpyod cing rtog la khong du chud par byed cing //
translated: When he investigates, examines, and penetrates these four noble truths,

original: rnam par 'jig pa na 'dus byas kyi khams la ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa na 'dus byas kyi khams la ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par mthong ngo //
translated: he sees the conditioned realm as impermanent, suffering, empty, and without self.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la ni skyabs dang / gnas dang / mgon dang / dpung gnyen du yang mthong la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la ni skyabs dang / gnas dang / mgon dang / dpung gnyen du yang mthong la /
translated: He sees the unconditioned realm as a refuge, a resting place, a protection, and a support.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams mngon sum du yang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams mngon sum du yang mi byed do //
translated: But he does not actualize the unconditioned realm.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa ba'i bdag rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa ba'i bdag rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way he knows the four noble truths.

original: de chos de dag nyan cing 'dzin pa dang / mang du byed cing yongs su rtog pa na /
analyzed: de chos de dag nyan cing 'dzin pa dang / mang du byed cing yongs su rtog pa na /
translated: and when they practice them a lot and contemplate them,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rab tu shes te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rab tu shes te /
translated: they understand dependent origination.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:🔽Conditioned by ignorance are compositional activity,🔽conditioned by compositional activity is consciousness,🔽conditioned by consciousness is name and form,🔽conditioned by name and form are the six sense spheres,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug dang / skye mched drug gi @310a *//
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug dang / skye mched drug gi @310a *//
translated: conditioned by the six sense spheres is contact,🔽conditioned by contact is feeling,🔽conditioned by feeling is craving,🔽conditioned by craving is appropriation,🔽conditioned by appropriation is existence,🔽conditioned by existence is birth,

original: rkyen gyis reg pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi ste /
analyzed: rkyen gyis reg pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi ste /
translated: and conditioned by birth is old age and death.

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called dependent origination.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ignorance that does not understand or see the four noble truths and dependent origination is called ignorance.

original: gang cung zad lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'am /🔽bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: gang cung zad lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'am / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: Whatever actions of body, speech, or mind are conducive to merit,🔽conducive to demerit,

original: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: conducive to immobility,

original: 'dod pa'i khams su nye bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su nye bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: conducive to the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams su nye bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su nye bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: conducive to the form realm,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su nye bar 'gro ba de dag ni 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su nye bar 'gro ba de dag ni 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: or conducive to the formless realm—these are called formations.

original: gang cung zad de las byung ba sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces bya ba de ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad de las byung ba sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces bya ba de ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever arises from that, called mind or thought, is called consciousness.

original: de las byung ba gang ci yang rung tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa de ni ming zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba gang ci yang rung tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa de ni ming zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever arises from that, such as feeling, perception, intention, contact, or attention, is called name.

original: gang ci yang rung lhan cig byung ba mer mer po'i gzugs dang / brdzus te byung ba'i gzugs dang / rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs de ni gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang ci yang rung lhan cig byung ba mer mer po'i gzugs dang / brdzus te byung ba'i gzugs dang / rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs de ni gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: Whatever it may be, the form that is present together with the kalala, the form that is spontaneously born, and the form that is intimation are called form.

original: de gnyis ni ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: These two are called name-and-form.

original: de las byung pa mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de ni skye mched drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung pa mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de ni skye mched drug ces bya'o //
translated: The arising of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind is called the six sense spheres.

original: mig la @310b brten cing gzugs la yang brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang / gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: mig la @310b brten cing gzugs la yang brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang / gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: The arising of eye consciousness in dependence on the eye and form, and the coming together of the three is contact.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / chos rnams la brten te /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / chos rnams la brten te /
translated: In dependence on the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, and mental objects,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang / gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang / gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa ste /
translated: the arising of mental consciousness, and the coming together of the three is contact.

original: de ni reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called contact.

original: de las byung ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: de las byung ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: The arising of pleasure,🔽pain,

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: or neither pleasure nor pain

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa de dag ni tshor ba gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa de dag ni tshor ba gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the three kinds of feelings.

original: de las byung ba 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang / dga' ba de ni sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang / dga' ba de ni sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The craving that arises from this, the desire, attachment, and delight, is called craving.

original: de las byung ba kun du chags pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba de ni len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba kun du chags pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba de ni len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attachment, view, discipline and austerity, and self-mortification that arise from this are called grasping.

original: de las byung ba gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa de ni srid pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa de ni srid pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The form, feeling, conception, formations, and consciousness that arise from this are called existence.

original: gang srid pa de 'byung ba dang / skye ba dang / mngon par 'grub pa de ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang srid pa de 'byung ba dang / skye ba dang / mngon par 'grub pa de ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising, birth, and manifestation of that existence is called birth.

original: gang srid pa de 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa dang / nye bar khrid pa de ni rga ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang srid pa de 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa dang / nye bar khrid pa de ni rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The change, destruction, and disappearance of that existence is called old age.

original: gang khrid pa de 'chi 'pho ba dang / 'bral ba de ni 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang khrid pa de 'chi 'pho ba dang / 'bral ba de ni 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The disappearance of that is called death.

original: de de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dpyod cing yongs su rtog la /🔽khong du chud par byed cing rnam par 'jig pa nas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: de de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dpyod cing yongs su rtog la / khong du chud par byed cing rnam par 'jig pa nas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: “In this way, they investigate, contemplate, and understand dependent origination.

original: sas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not conceptualize it, nor do they conceptualize the earth.

original: sa bdag gi snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: sa bdag gi snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: They do not conceptualize the earth as ‘mine.’

original: sa la mngon par dga' bar mi byed do //🔽chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam @311a *//
analyzed: sa la mngon par dga' bar mi byed do // chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam @311a *//
translated: They do not delight in the earth.

original: par shes pa la gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la rlom sems su mi byed; mya ngan las 'das pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: par shes pa la gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la rlom sems su mi byed; mya ngan las 'das pas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not conceptualize water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness as being the same or different, nor do they conceptualize what is seen, heard, distinguished, or cognized, or nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bdag gi'o snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
